It is possible a little bit of the rim (some parts without protection, so quite dangerous if you have kids) but for the rest there are beatiful overlooks reachable by car.
The canyon itself it is fantastic with colours that are incredible. It is very common to see also osprey that have nest on the walls.

Took a walk along the top of the canyon and the scenery is absolutely stunning. Also managed to spot a bird nesting on the far side of the canyon on an isolated point which was a highlight for the kids.

places_url_reviews_title: One of the highlights of Yellowstone, not to be missed.
places_url_reviews_comment: This place was incredible. I love waterfalls. Definitely one of the highlights of the park, possibly my favorite part, not to be missed.

places_url_reviews_title: The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone was superb!
places_url_reviews_comment: It was fantastic to see Yellowstone Falls and the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. I did a hike under a mile to the bottom. It was great to see different vantage points of the falls. Parking in this area can be stressful. I saw an elk nearby, as well.

If your a good hiking or have some adventure then going to the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is a place to go. To get a great view of the water fall you have to go about 56 stories down and a narrow switch back path and when you go down you have to walk back up it.... but the view is amazing and with it if you can walk it. There are vies for up top and yes it’s amazing to look out and see this Canyon the parking is a bit of a pain especially if you have a big truck but that’s all over Yellowstone we parked at the first. Area and hiked to the viewing area which was nice

places_url_reviews_title: Great sights of the canyon and falls
places_url_reviews_comment: We visited the attraction one beautiful afternoon and enjoyed the scenery all around. Parking is not as acute as some other attractions like Old Faithful and Grand Prismatic Basin for obvious reasons. There are much more intense sights all over the park that must be enjoyed within a short time. It is a mini version of Niagara Falls and Grand Canyon Arizona combined. It was impressive but did not wow us.

This part of the park is simply gorgeous (though to be fair the whole park is). Easy trails form the parking area make the overlooks accessible. we keep coming back every few years , it never tires. Pictures can't do it justice.

The Upper Falls, Lower Falls and seeing the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone was stunning. It was exactly like the pictures, only I was there in real life to see it in 3D! This was truly amazing. The canyon is SO deep and the colors were beautiful.

places_url_reviews_title: An amazing view that takes your breath away!
places_url_reviews_comment: This view is definately worth the stop. It is not far from the parking lot to view the amazing falls and canyon.

We took a 3 mile hike counterclockwise starting at South Rim. We carried bear spray and wore long sleeves and jeans. The hike took us through prairie, forest, by mud pots and steamers, and ponds to get to the North Rim. Following the North Rim was beautiful, as well as Artist’s Point. As we hiked closer to the waterfall, the roar became more intense and we could see steam being released as well as a green color to the falls. This was a good workout and beautiful.

The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is simply gorgeous. The view from the vantage point is amazing.. Artist point is the view of the Canyon and the Lower falls, it is great for pictures. Take advantage of many trails, lookouts and the panoply of majestic colorful display of nature while you are here. Absolutely spectacular and inspiring view.
A great place to look at, drive around and, if you are lucky with the weather a great place to take a walk. Stunning.

The view from atop the canyon was quite amazing. We even saw an osprey atop one of the peaks. Additionally, we could view the falls from the same vantage point. Leaving here we came upon an Elk cleaning the velvet off its antlers.

places_url_reviews_title: Beautiful and a short paved walk
places_url_reviews_comment: We got there just after the sunrise. Very cold however it was a short and easy walk. Some of the best scenery pics we got were here. Worth the stop!

Sure there are hordes of people all taking the same pictures and walking the canyon-rim trails, but we are all there for a reason - the canyon is beautiful and the lower falls in particular are worth viewing from various locations. Ignore the crowds - enjoy the view!

places_url_reviews_title: Don’t Miss the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone
places_url_reviews_comment: I’ve visited Yellowstone Park many, many times over the years. The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is my favorite attraction! Many people visit the Park without taking advantage of the many trails and lookouts of the gorgeous Canyon and Falls. It’s accessible for any skill level and for however much time you have available. Walk to the brink of the Upper Falls to get a feel for the power of the river as it roars over the falls. There are also trails along the Canyon rim. Artist Point is the view of the Canyon and Lower Falls that you see on all the post cards.
I hadn’t really come to Yellowstone for the canyon; for me it was all about the geological features like the geysers. The canyon though is breathtaking and worth spending a full day exploring.

places_url_reviews_title: Totally Amazing Views... don’t miss this...!
places_url_reviews_comment:
Awesome experience... one of our most enjoyed views, vistas, and hikes while visiting Yellowstone...! Fortunately we stayed nearby at the Canyon Lodge, so we visited this magnificent canyon 3 different times...! Our last hike was early in the morning... there were only a few others visiting at that time...!!! We hiked down the Lookout Point - Red Rock Trail to view the Yellowstone River Falls... what views!!!
Hike back up was actually easier... no worries about sliding on the gravel going up...!!!
Highly recommend - unbelievable rewards...!!!
Great afternoon, plan a few hours. Great sites and wildlife. Pick a valley to couple with this adventure. There is plenty to see
Great hiking on many different areas and levels. Very beautiful and a much different look than most of Yellowstone.
This is a must see on your trip to Yellowstone. If you get there when the sun is at horizon, it makes the best photos. trails to hike
Came here after dinner each evening while in the park and was my favorite part of the day! Stayed at Western Cabins and it was a short walk to the North rim.
This is a must see for anyone visiting Yellowstone. Great easy hike in and scenic views. Lots of Kodak moments
We had a very nice drive on the loop that gets you back to canyon village. It was very busy but we had time for it.
Awesome views. Amazing to think this sits in the middle of this landscape. Must see if your visiting Yellowstone National Park.
It was some hiking involved to see it, but worth it. Absolutely beautiful views in every direction. Must see!

Great place to visit, specifically Artist Point. Spectacular scenery, centered about Lower Falls of Yellowstone River. However: This location gets hoards of tourists. So, arrive early. Best view of Lower Falls is in the morning [possible spectrum in mists at bottom of falls].

places_url_reviews_title: It really is nice, but I was expecting to be further from traffic and flat landers.
places_url_reviews_comment: The views are spectacular. You don't have to hike the trail, you drive and pull over to see much of it. Well worth seeing if you are in Yellowstone. Sadly, upper falls was blocked and lower falls is a 600' drop and then climb out.
Do not miss this panoply of colors - it’s a spectacular display of the majesty of nature. It’s hard to understand why this isn’t the #1 site to see in Yellowstone!

This is a fantastic location. The views are worth the walk. Unfortunately Uncle Tom's Trail was closed but the South Rim Trail to Artist Point was great. Definitely make the effort and walk the entire way.
The view at Artist's Point is especially great for photos. We enjoyed the stairs at Uncle Tom's outlook. We looked at these Falls from every vantage point we could find.
We took a Road Scholars trip to Yellowstone and the Grand Canyon was one of our favorite stops. The colors of the rock were beautiful. It was a perfect month to see the nearby falls.

Another Grand Canyon ( there is the one in Arizona, but another one in Kauai - Waimea, and in Mexico too ... and GOD knows how many else in the USofA ...) but neat , and clean and with manicured access And rangers everywhere ...
Been to the GC several times in my life and this was the first time here. It is just as beautiful to me. Great place and make sure you get to Artist Point...

places_url_reviews_title: Grand Canyon / Grand View / Grand Fun !!
places_url_reviews_comment: WOW is all you can say... It is truly amazing and a stop that is Not-To-Be-Missed. This is a highlight of the park and you will love it. Recommend

places_url_reviews_title: The colors and the mountains are breathtaking
places_url_reviews_comment: I got a little confused about calling this the Grand Canyon, but it is truly a beautiful sight. When you look down you will see water flowing. I loved the oranges and reds in the mountain.

Best thing to see in park. Go early (be there by 9am latest to avoid people & parking jams). Start with south rim to get east sun shining on canyon walls. Then go to north rim which is one-way road south to north (park at Lookout point and walk paved trail to Grandview which is easy short walk with great views along the way).

Seeing the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone was a great stop to walk around and see the amazing views in depths of the canyon. There are many places that you can view the canyon and the waterfall. There are many other picture ups as well. There was only one public bathroom that was very busy.It is a very busy place with parking can be an issue sometimes.
Well worth the stop when touring Yellowstone national Park.
Go see Grand Prismatic so amazing and take the hike up the overlook you get a better view. You can see the overlook at Fairy Falls it’s worth it!!!!
It’s a must see. I would definitely put this on my priority list. The hike down to the lower falls isn’t worth it if you have bad knees. Yes he view above is spectacular!!!
The most beautiful part of Yellowstone! We all agreed Artist point was the ultimate visual treat....awe inspiring!
One of the highlights of Yellowstone National Park. It is a deep canyon with the Yellowstone River at the bottom. The views around the canyon are breathtaking.
Yellowstone NP is filled with so many stunning, awesome things to see. This is one of them. It is a must-see, add it to the itinerary!

The Falls are a must see at Yellowstone, and we recommend the South Rim Trail, at least out to Artist's Point, in order to get the best views. Trail is about a mile and a half each way, and shaded in the mornings, so it's not a bad hike, with only a few steep sections. The North Rim is more an auto tour, with multiple pullouts along the way.

places_url_reviews_title: This is the view that inspired the national park system
places_url_reviews_comment:
After spending time in the Grand Canyon (AZ), every other state's "grand canyon" can be less than awesome. But not this one. We were totally surprised by the size - depth, width, length - of the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone.
We sat through an interesting, but brief, Ranger talk at Artist's Point, and then spent a good hour enjoying the view from that area. This is the view that Thomas Moran painted in 1871 and which became part of the inspiration for Congress to create the first national park in the world, and for President Grant to sign the bill into law.
We also took it in from Lookout Point and Grand View - totally worth taking in both the South Rim and North Rim drives.
Visit the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone and view the Upper and Lower Falls for great views. Make sure to visit both the North and South Rim.

We have visited our fair share of national parks, so we did not expect to be so surprised by the beauty and uniqueness of this small canyon. It is so special! We took the long trail loop that starts near the picnic area by the bridge, walked through a field then a forested area, past several steaming mud flats and ponds/lakes, to Artist's Point for a ranger talk about the canyon. We then continued on the South Canyon Rim Trail to take in the views of the Lower Falls then the Upper Falls. Unforgettable!

Beautiful waterfalls decorate this canyon. There are multiple viewpoints along the North and South Rim. Personally enjoyed Artist Point at the South Rim the best. We were here during the middle of the day which is fairly busy and always found parking spots.
We enjoyed seeing the beautiful iconic yellow stone and waterfalls. It was simply breathtaking and the kids did well on the hike from the south rim toward Uncle Tom's.

There are several areas to stop and park at to view the canyon. We chose to stop and take a short hike to Artist’s Point at the Lower Falls. For me, it was the most gorgeous part of the park as it lives up to its name! Plenty of parking with restrooms on site. The falls and the Yellowstone River are highly visible here as the river then runs through the canyon. Simply breathtaking!

Take the hike to artist point. It’s an easy hike and well worth the views. Also make the trek to the lower falls overlook. This is a steep hike down with MANY switchbacks but to see the falls from this angle is well worth it. It’s suitable for children but adults but it is strenuous

places_url_reviews_title: Lives up to the Grand Canyon comparison
places_url_reviews_comment: Usually, comparison to a world-famous attraction ends up being a disappointing experience but not in this case. This is a must-visit attraction in YP.

places_url_reviews_title: Wish I would have walked down
places_url_reviews_comment: It is an impressive site. We probably missed the best vantage point because of the construction signs leading us to the north side. However we still got wonderful pictures. We didn’t walk to the bottom because it was cold and raining.
Be ready for steep walk to brink of falls but well worth the climb.. all views of canyon amazing ... every direction you look is beautiful

places_url_reviews_title: The Falls gets a 5+, the park maintenance budget gets a 2: CALL CONGRESS!
places_url_reviews_comment: Of course the Falls are spectacular, and the hikes down to overlooks are steep but worth the exertion. I choose to write instead about the maintenance issues. I have posted some photos of broken fencing, trails that were closed off due to safety issues, and other maintenance problems. This is the fault of Congress, not the National Parks Service, which has a $12 billion maintenance backlog. If you love your national parks, call your member of Congress and complain about their underfunding of parks. It matters here, where the only thing keeping your precious child from falling over a sheer cliff is a broken fence. Of course your other choice is to pay $50 instead of $35 at the gate next year, but that doesn't seem very American....

Visited the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone during a trip in early June. Pictures, or words, cannot describe the scenery. One really needs to come here for themselves to see firsthand what this area has to offer.
The view of the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone was truly beautiful and quite amazing. Parking was a problem due to large numbers of vehicles in the parking area provided.

I wasn't ready for this. My wife had suggested Yellowstone as a destination and I knew it was going to be impressive, but I had no idea what kind of things we were going to find there. So, the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone was a total surprise.
We saw it on the map, but didn't really take it seriously. Even when we parked the car and followed the clear signposts: it looked like a river carving its own little canyon. But when we stood on the lip of that canyon and looked down at the river and the sulphur deposits that decorated the sides of the enormous canyon! Grand Canyon is no exaggeration. This place is absolutely spectacular. We just couldn't get enough of it.
Well-marked trails. Safe and well-chosen viewpoints. It was all aid out for us. But we didn't even mind the crowds. Glimpses of coloured deposits turned into dazzling, dramatic canyon views as we made our way through the surrounding trees.
We lingered longer than we expected. It never got old.

The views are exceedingly good and the driving is not too strenuous. We saw a small bear that had created a massive traffic jam but it is not always that you find a bear walking without a care in the world in the Park.
If you spend 1 day in Yellowstone you have to see the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. It is superb!

This was one of my favorite places in Yellowstone. Seeing the canyon and the waterfalls is simply stunning. Arrive here early or explore in the evening to get gorgeous lighting and escape the crowds. You can park and do short walks out to viewpoints or go for longer hikes--totally up to you! We came here early AM and also came back to Artist Point for sunset and enjoyed both experiences equally.
If you have seen other canyons in other Nationalpark you wont regret to have walked the way down to the waterfall. Very nice spot for amazing pictures and Insta stories.

This canyon and waterfall is spectacular. It’s a must stop for everyone coming to Yellowstone. You can view it from a distance or walk down to the brink of the lower falls and stand on a platform right where the rushing water falls over the edge. Fantastic!!
The southern rim trail was an unexpected find. It’s a little long but gorgeous. It ends at artist point so if you have two cars leave one there.
There is a lot of great views in this canyon but extremely busy in July. I recommend getting here early so you don’t have to deal with the parking issues.
Beautiful scenery, including water falls and variety colored cliffs. Nice trail, some steep inclines. Worth the work.
There were many spots to visit the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. There is construction in the area as of July 2019 and some backups but never had to wait more than 10 minutes

It is Grand because it is colorful -red,yellow,ivory,white,some what green stones with deep green water , it is Grand because it’s deep, it’s grand as it is long, it’s grand because it give astounding feeling, it has 3 falls, but most popular is lower falls, which gives scenic view from very close & afar. It is nearly 4000 ft wide and more than 1000 ft deep and 20 miles long.its total view is breathtaking. Must see👌

places_url_reviews_title: Your eyes need a rest after this travel.
places_url_reviews_comment: Take your time as you drive around and enjoy this incredible view. The Yellowstone Grand Canyon is only one of the incredible items to see and enjoy at this National Treasure.

If you just visit Old Faithful and don't see the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone, you've missed over half the experience of Yellowstone. Incredible scenery. Good talking trails. Several good hiking trails. A "must see."
Such wonderful views. Very windy but the canyon and river are picture perfect. East walking trails. Kids also loved the benches built into the rocks
I really didn't know about this section of the park. Amazing spot, great overlooks and trails along the rim. Take time to enjoy all the sights along this drive.
Do yourself a favor and view this Grand Canyon!! It is breathtaking!! The long distance view of the waterfall is awesome.

I was looking forward to seeing this area, after reading the reviews on it. I was a little worried that my expectations were too high. I felt like it looked fake in everyone's pictures. I can now say, it met and exceeded my expectations! It is so beautiful that it does look fake.
We drove both the north and south rim to see the different viewpoints. We got to the north rim first, which the ranger said will get more backed up as the day goes on. We didn't have any trouble finding parking, and we were there around 8:30 am. We hiked the trail to the Brink of the Lower Falls and the Red Rock Trail. Both were beautiful and worth it.
The Brink of the Upper Falls and Uncle Tom's Trail was closed when we were here on June 25.
We did drive on the South Rim Road to Artist's Point is a must as well. This area is very awe-inspiring.
Lower falls hike is a great way to see the Grand Canyon! I highly recommend the artist point trail, stunning views! It’s a must do in Yellowstone

places_url_reviews_title: not to the same scale as the grand canyon
places_url_reviews_comment: but i think just as stunning due to the large waterfalls that you can get quite close to. plenty of great walks and photo hot spots to look back on with awe!
Gorgeous views of the colorful canyon walls, a waterfall, and the river that cuts through the canyon. Worth a stop!

places_url_reviews_title: Not the same as the Grand Canyon, But still Great
places_url_reviews_comment: An amazing site, look out for mountain (Bighorn) sheep along the cliffs. It is really Quite spectacular.
great place to see. Walk around and see spy the points ear marked for good views. We also saw Nest onto of peaks. Amazing colours of nature

places_url_reviews_title: Upper Falls, Artist Points, Inspiration Point, many more
places_url_reviews_comment: They are located in the northeast of Yellowstone National Park. There are many point to stop along the way and around the areas. I like the Inspiration Point because there was no tour bus, only few cars, and it’s beautiful.
Definately worth seeing! Beautiful waterfalls and rock formations. I have yet to hike here - but it looks fantastic.

Beauty all around. We took a private tour with EcoTours of Wyoming. Our guide, Sarah, took us to many places in the park, and we ended our tour here. It was so beautiful. Awesome and powerful. A must see.

Mind blown. Do not really need to say more than this but need 100 words to post. Somehow had missed the Canyon on a previous trip. It is a must. The pictures do not do justice to the beauty of this place.

This was definitely worth the drive. We took the trail hike down to see the lower falls and were not disappointed. We also drove around to the other side and loved the views. The water level was too high for the staircase to be open.

Man could not come close to creating such beautiful vistas as this. The walls of the canyon are colorful and vary from rock to fragile Yellowstone to tree covered. There are various outlook points on both the south and north rims, all worth seeing and hiking (steps and switch back down 200 - 600 ft at some points).

places_url_reviews_title: High cliffs with a grand view
places_url_reviews_comment: The place has many hiking trails. The cliffs are very high and you should always watch your kids to prevent any accidents. There are 2 falls upper and lower falls. You can spend many hours just exploring the place.
Georgeous place. Can't believe how lucky I was to have experienced this beautiful place and had an amazing guide ... Stephen

places_url_reviews_title: one of my favorite parts of the park
places_url_reviews_comment: i always return to this spot for every visit It is just too amaing with waterfall and the the canyons
In addition to viewing the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone, you need to check out the Lower Falls. Just beautiful!

This is a must see attraction in Yellowstone. If you can hit it earlier in the morning. When we got there mid afternoon the tour buses were in full force and so were all the tourists. It was a challenge to get a good spot to grab a few pics. Even with all that do not pass this up on your Yellowstone visit.

Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone was amazing, even in the last days of winter (we were there in May, but there was still a lot of snow on the ground and snow banks on the road to the view points). I was surprised as I hadn't done my homework; deep gorge, beautiful views. An amazing place among many in the Park.

places_url_reviews_title: My favorite spot the whole day at Yellowstone
places_url_reviews_comment: The canyon was surprising to me. I really did not expect it to be so amazing. I was most disappointed that we did not give ourselves enough time at that spot. I would have really liked to have hiked down to the lower falls. Some others coming up from the hike said it was beautiful and well worth it.

This is another spot to include when you are doing the Grand Canyon. Again, parking can be a little problematic, so it might be good to go later in the day or earlier in the day if you are staying in the park.

This is such a beautiful location. Get out and walk around at each pull out. Inspiration point is breathtaking. We were blessed with great weather. Sunny and cool. A feast for the eyes and senses. Take pictures but stop and just look around with your eyes and listen with your ears. It’s all so magical. We are blessed to live in such a beautiful country!
Lots of RV parking and car parking. There are 2 parking lots. Busy place so be patient, it’s worth the visit to see this beautiful sight!! Bathrooms in parking lot.
Wonderful views of the upper and the lower falls of the Yellowstone River. Followed the South Rim trail and there many great photo opportunities.

Many stops along south and north rims, upper falls and a few trails were closed for repairs. Scenery was unbelievable. Lots of stops along the way for restrooms and photo ops. Some walking to get to views, and other longer trails available

The views were wonderful. We went end of June , it was not crowded. It was cool but comfortable if you bring some warm clothes. I don't like the cold and I was fine. No problem finding parking. Lots of different view points you could visit even if you are not in shape to hike. My favorite part of yellowstone other than my love of hiking. . The river is full and fast due to the Spring snow melt.
Nothing compared to the Grand Canyon but magnificent nonetheless. Stop here to see some wonderful scenery.

places_url_reviews_title: Great place to view amazing geology
places_url_reviews_comment: One of the many beautiful places in Yellowstone. We loved the views and wonderment of this place. The fall was delightful.
Both the lower rim drive and uppper rim drive provide amazing views of the Canyon. This was a highlight of the trip.
Worth a look even a hike. Central in park we found ourselves stopping several times on our way to and from lake, horseback riding, camping nearby.
Such a wonderful area. You'll love the sights and you'll love the wildlife. Lots to do and see. Spend some time and enjoy.

This canyon is located along the main road in Yellowstone on the east side of the park. There are two drives one on the north side of the canyon and one on the south side. The road along the north side is one way and loops back to the canyon visitor center. The views of the huge waterfall is amazing. There are trails or stairs that take you down to see the falls from close to river level but it is a long hard trip back to the parking area. The first stop at brink of the lower falls is one of the best views. Inspiration Point is the last stop on the north rim drive and the view from there is fantastic. All of the overlooks are well worth the time but the first and last to me are best. This drive can be very crowded and there may be waits to find a parking spot. If you can get there early in the day you will have less issues. The south rim drive is a road in and the same path back out. There are several overviews to view the upper falls and all are great. The last is artist point and it to me is the best view. All overviews are an easy walk from the parking. I did not expect the canyon to be one of my favorite things in the park but it was. Don’t miss it.
This was so amazing! One of my favorite Yellowstone sights!! The waterfall, hikes, and the view at sunset is beyond gorgeous. Don’t miss out on this if you go to Yellowstone!

I had never heard of any other Grand Canyon besides the one in Arizona. This is isn't as long or as deep, but in many ways, it is just as majestic. We saw it from the south rim close to the Lower Falls and fell in love with it, considering it to be one of the best attractions in the entire park.

places_url_reviews_title: Day 3 in this park and our FAVORITE, by far
places_url_reviews_comment: Wow! This eastern part of the park is so different from the geysers and basins and we loved it! Some of us took the hike down to the head of the falls; others went halfway (it was extremely steep going down) and one chose to forego it altogether. But there are plenty of vista points to view it even if you don't want to hike it. Inspiration Point was a great place to do that- on a one-way road that allows parking and great photo ops.

Spent two weeks travelling area and appreciate all that we saw.
Grand. Canyon area was especially good to see . So much you need this time . Road blocked with animals on road including. Bison . Car parks can be very busy even when we were in June.
Shudder to think what they might be like in very busy times
Well worth all the trouble and strife getting around once in a lifetime experience All staff we came in contact with were very helpful including Rangers .

Probably our favorite part of Yellowstone! The Grand Canyon area of Yellowstone is stunning & both the views of the Upper & Lower Falls are just spectacular. More parking is available than what you will find at many area in Yellowstone. Make sure this is on your list!
Arrive at the north rim by 8AM to avoid the rush, and be sure to hike down to the numerous falls viewpoints. Each hike is about 30 minutes round trip.
Beautiful area. Two rims to visit. Some construction so some areas closed. Go early and beat the traffic. Parking can be limited.

This was one of the coolest places in Yellowstone, with two waterfalls and a canyon reminiscent of the grand canyon in Arizona. We took a hike on the north rim, which was just a walk, but more or less straight up and down using a path with many switchbacks. The view at the bottom - right next to the waterfall - was awesome. There are overlooks that are much more accessible too though. And much more crowded.

places_url_reviews_title: Every cloud or bit of sun shows different colors in the rocks
places_url_reviews_comment: This has become a necessary stop on all our trips to Yellowstone. The light on the canyon walls is incredibly beautiful.
Obviously a must see stop. Take a pic. Enjoy the scenery. All of yellowstone was beautiful and this is up there.

Hiked over to Artistic Point, Waterfalls and canyon are beautiful! There is also a parking lot for those who are driving over and then an easy walk to Artistic Point from there. Not ADA friendly, just too rough a trail. But the overlook to the falls I would say is ADA. I was with a hiking group and we came in from another trail. Beautiful views!

With the many different overlooks, I was able to get a full view of rage Canyon even with my bum knee. If you are mobile, you can even get better views. The falls are fantastic. The canyon’s history is well covered in the signs. This is a must see. It may not be the Grand Canyon or Niagara Falls, but it is still one of America’s best

places_url_reviews_title: This was well worth a long drive
places_url_reviews_comment: Couldn’t believe just how beautiful and amazing this place was, viewed from several different stops and is awe inspiring. Almost a tearful moment. Definitely one I won’t forget.
If you have the chance to see this park, please don’t hesitate, it is absolutely beautiful and there is so much to see

places_url_reviews_title: Not the real Grand Canyon but still beautiful.
places_url_reviews_comment: The rock formations are amazing and the colors you see are spectacular. Not the size or magnificence of the Arizona Grand Canyon but still well worth your time.
This is a definite must fir everyone. It's one of my favorite places in Yellowstone. It was snowing when we visited, amazing!
This is one thing to put on your must see list in Yellowstone. Its amazing. Im not sure if I’ve ever seen so many colors in one area, very surreal.
Get here early must do the Lower Falls Brink trail, though a bit of a hike back up. Uncle Toms Trail was closed again 3 years in a row this thing has been closed.

So beautiful. A must see! Yellowstone is huge andxwe did the best we could to see most of it..we were coming back from mammoth hot springs and decided to do the 12 mile drive to the grand canyon..so worth it!! Even ran into a Buffalo traffic jam lol!

See from as many angles as possible.
We worth doing the short hikes to the brink of the falls and also to the bottom.
Top sight in Yellowstone

There are many ways to experience this natural feature and your choice will influence how much you enjoy it. Both the north and south rim drives are worth doing as they provide a variety of overlooks to see both the canyon and the upper and lower falls. The problem is the popularity of these drives and overlooks means it can be very difficult to get parking Patience and advance planning(come early) reduce the problems. We went on s short hike from the artist point parking lot along the rim of the canyon which was a great way to really see the colors of the canyon. This is not to be missed
Easy visit in a car . Stunning view from Artist point . Some of the trails were closed due to repair work
I kinda think so. Stunning colors, amazing waterfalls. Artists point — I would love to go there everyday! Personally though, I don’t think the hike to the brink of the falls is worthwhile.

Out of all the wonderful things Yellowstone offers Artist Point is definitely our favorite stop. It offers some of the most picturesque views. Both times we’ve been there, June and September, we have had no problems with parking since we got there around 4-5 and there was parking a plenty. Lookout Point has its own charms as well and a lot of elk wonder around there.

I kept reading about how this place resembled a mini-Grand Canyon, and it really does in many ways. Think we drove through the viewing area on the North side of the canyon (upper) closest to the lodge. Plenty of vehicles, and in fact, parking was at a premium. Thus, 4 stars instead of 5. We enjoyed the various viewpoints that line the parking area, and worked our way all along it. Because the wife was still recuperating from a foot operation, we did not trudge very far down any trails, but we did fine at the viewpoints, some of which have stairways that take you down to overlooks that seem to be right on top of the canyon. It's fun looking at the falls from a distance and watching the way the river churns through the canyon. Loved the canyon and the crevices and precipices, and it was even fun watching folks on the other side of the canyon. But you had better bring binoculars if you really want to savor the details. A hailstorm eventually drove us back to our car and the safety of the cocktail lounge in the village. So there's that, too! Great to have a martini waiting nearby.

places_url_reviews_title: If you do one thing at Yellowstone, this should be it
places_url_reviews_comment: The views of the Grand Canyon are simply amazing. Artist Point is the best place to take it all in. After a jam-packed couple of days at Yellowstone, this was my favorite part by far.

Some of the most iconic views of Yellowstone at your fingertips. The North Rim is best for hikes (IMHO) and Uncle Tom's Trail gets you up close and personal. All the hikes are worth the effort. On the South Rim, there are short walks to viewpoints, fabulous views without paying the price of the steep hikes back up. Something for the fit, and also for the not-so-fit.

This site is surprisingly majestic and stunning. In some ways I enjoyed it as much or more than the Grand Canyon of the Colorado. The colors change as the sun moves along the canyon. It is just amazing to watch and a pleasure to enjoy.

places_url_reviews_title: Not for the faint of heart!
places_url_reviews_comment: The trek down to the observation platforms is quite the trek - especially back up. I can see this being a problem for those who are out of shape or the elderly. I'm not even sure how many switchbacks there are - but there are A LOT and it's all up hill...pretty steep. It takes you down to an upper observation platform and then a lower one that is right next to the raging river and the falls. You are definitely rewarded with some amazing sites if you make it down there. The amazing power of the river and the falls right there at your fingertips and then the majestic views that look more like a painting then real life. It's definitely worth a visit if you are near but be warned that it is NOT an easy walk back up.
Our time was short and we considered skipping this area...DON'T...It was very beautiful and well worth visiting.

The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone was more impressive than I thought it would be. It’s a short walk to the main overlook, and from there you can see both the waterfall and the canyon. There are several trails to hike if you are interested.
At the overlook, there was a park ranger who was very helpful and interesting. She told us about the Osprey pair that had a nest in the canyon. In fact, we saw them and the nest, but she said there were no eggs this year. Enjoyed this stop and would highly recommend!
When I first hear Grand Canyon, I thought sure. But once I saw the combination of waterfall and canyon I changed my mind. I does live up to it's name.
Even in the rain and hail (twice!) this place is too beautiful to miss! There are so many different viewpoints it’s worth more than one stop.
Must see! Don’t skip this amazing feature of Yellowstone!!!! We did the Lower Brinks hike and the bottom view is great.

places_url_reviews_title: Must stop site while at Yellowstone
places_url_reviews_comment: Just another great contrast in the environment of this park. The GC of Yellowstone truly is a unique experience. Don't just rely on the high level overlook to experience this portion of the park. Take the path to the falls overlook and other less traveled areas. Some are a little more strenuous than others, but well worth the effort.

anything you get to see of this magnitude is worth the time. Try and visit on a weekday or early morning for less congestion.
Love our National Park!

There are several viewing points on either side of the canyon. Artist Point is the best and best known so expect crowds. Parking is pretty good, but restrooms are limited so expect long lines. We stayed at Lake Lodge the first night in the park and did the wile east side in one day - the canyon is on the east side above fishing bridge and the road to Cody. The canyon has to be one of your “must see” stops in the park.
Beautiful canyon plus waterfall. Trails are nicely structured to that it is a joy to experience the whole canyon.
This is the canyon that a member of our party was anxious to see. It is breathtaking and a sight to behold.

There aren’t words to describe the beauty of this stop in the Canyon area of Yellowstone. It can get busy with busses, but we were always able to get a spot for a great picture. We did the hike to the brink of the lower falls, which was great. It’s 600 feet down, which means, 600 feet straight up! It can be taxing, but well worth the effort!
Worth the overlook. Really pretty and a great view of the water. It's so serene and you're up pretty high, but definitely worth the visit. The Canyon area is our favorite - worth the drive!

places_url_reviews_title: A truly Grand Canyon for sure.
places_url_reviews_comment: This is a truly amazing wonder of nature and one of the most beautiful waterfalls you will ever see (Lower Falls, that is) and one of many wonders of Yellowstone. I’m however dropping one star due to practicalities - disappointment that several of the trails (including the Uncle Tom Steps) going into the high season are out of use, and also the parking (on the North Rim) - even in early June - is difficult, so goodness knows what it will be like in July/August. Maybe they have more elaborate controls in operation when its busy but if not be prepared to go very early in the day, or take a longish walk down from the Canyon Village (or elsewhere) to avoid the car parks.

It IS so much more colorful and glamorous than the Grand Canyon due to the fact it's not as deep, which allows ou to see so much more along the river and also the waterfall is fantastic. Be sure to take a hike all the way down to the waterfall, a special place.
Went in early May which meant less of a crowd. Beautiful view and a great place to take a group photo!
Unusual rock formations, great view of the valley created by the movement of the earth. The different colors of the different layers of earth were striking.

places_url_reviews_title: So many different ways to see the canyon, take your pick based on skill level.
places_url_reviews_comment: There are many different trails to see the canyon and falls so pick one that matches how far you want to walk and how steep a trail you can handle. Be prepared for huge tour buses full of foreign tourists who hog the best spots on overlooks for selfies. Just be patient and wait your turn. It's worth it. Or you can take a trail that is not popular with the bus crowd like The Brink.
The hike down to see both falls is well worth it. Just be advised you are at high altitude and it may be difficult to catch your breat coming up.

places_url_reviews_title: Amazing surprise, even if you have seen the Grand Canyon (Az)
places_url_reviews_comment: Just walking up to the lookout provides and breathtaking view of the waterfalls. Hike further up the trail towards Sublime Point to see an amazing array of colors
The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is always great to view, I never get tired of it. This is one of the must see sites when visiting Yellowstone. Be sure not to miss it.
We saw the canyon from the north and south viewpoints and it was gorgeous. The hike to the brink of the lower falls was steep, but put you in the “brink.”

Mother Nature has provided a wonderful environment with beautiful scenery. The National Park Service has provided easy access and ideal viewing stations. This is a must see if going to Yellowstone. Like all the sights there, this one fills up quickly as the tourist season gets into full swing. I'd recommend an early spring or late fall visit but whenever you visit, you can't beat the views.

places_url_reviews_title: All the awe of Grand Canyon, Just a Little Smaller
places_url_reviews_comment: Loved our visit to the GCOY. We hiked down to the waterfall and visited both sides of the canyon. Highly recommend for awe inspiring views.
The hike was short and steep but within the capabilities of my 77 yr old decently fit husband. One of the best views in the park.
The views are stunning. It is amazing to stand and gaze out into the distance. The trip is worth it and it is a little crowded. Take time to listen to the park rangers

Both rims are amazing views, but I think the south rim has better views of the falls, do if you have limited time, I would do that side.
Don’t miss the north and south rim drives. Worth it. Awe inspiring! We even saw egrets nesting on rocks.

The sheer size of the Lower Falls, the pounding river and the colorful painted canyon walls combine to create an unforgettable picture. Artist’s point and the North Rim Drive are both excellent viewing points. For those who want a closer view and a challenge, tale the 300+ staircase in Uncle Tom’s Trail to get a closer look at the lower Falls.
Worth a stop, but not nearly as Grand as advertised. It was snowing the day we were there. so limited visibility may make my review more harsh than on a bright, clear, warmer day.
The views of the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone were phenomenal. The colors here are vastly different than anywhere else in the park.
Beautiful vistas. Educational. Animals galore. Very easy to navigate. For all ages. Hard to explain unless you see it for yourself.

Beautiful! Worth the drive along the Great Loop at Canyon Village, so much to look at and take in and there are just so many gorgeous vistas along the route.

It is amazing place on earth.
There are 2 best spots to view.

places_url_reviews_comment: When I planned this trip, I never imagine I will see how beauty and wise is our earth, our planet...stunning colors and views, strong current waters forming this beautiful waterfall...I will come back again...

places_url_reviews_title: Nice canyon views of the falls!
places_url_reviews_comment: Enjoyed seeing the "Grand Canyon" of Yellowstone. Offers a different perspective of a canyon. Roads are nicely maintained and the traffic was bearable.

This is well worth seeing. It is a spectacular park feature. There are incredible views of the valley a falls. It is a photo stop for sure!

I think the Grand Canyon in Yellowstone is much more impressive than the other Grand Canyon. Who knew what something so marvelous was inside the park? Beautiful

The Grand Canyon area of Yellowstone is one of the most picturesque parts of the park, and very different from the well-known geo-thermal areas. This part of the park is a must see, since it is why the park is called “Yellowstone.” From these overlooks peering into the gorge, you can see the yellow walls of the canyon that gave Yellowstone its name.
We visited in late September, and got early starts at the first light of dawn. We were rewarded with incredible views of this area, and at most of the overlooks, we had the park to ourselves. Don’t pay any attention to comparisons to the actual Grand Canyon or to Niagara Falls. Each of the national parks we have visited have their own special beauty and we appreciate each of their unique vistas. The views of Yellowstone Canyon were just extraordinary.
We visited North Rim Drive first. This is a one way loop where you can drive and stop at the successive viewpoints to admire this breathtaking area. This worked well for us, since we really don’t hike, but could still experience incredible views with very little effort. We stopped at all of the easy points along the way; Brink of the Lower Falls, Lookout Point, Grandview, and Inspiration Point. Each of these views gave a different view of the gorge and the Lower Falls, and every different view was amazing. Some tourists skip these views and only go to Artists Point. What a huge mistake! Spend the time to explore these other views. You won’t be disappointed!
Just an FYI. The signage for Inspiration Point is very confusing. The first sign you see is not Lookout Point. It is a trail that has sheer drop-offs, and really should be cordoned off for safety. The actual observation point is at the next sign, and is an area that just opened up from construction. This overlook has numerous steps to the view, and is absolutely stunning. The park really did a great job at this site. Always look for official park signs with maps, which mark the actual overlooks.
We then headed back toward Canyon Junction, and turned south to pick up South Rim Drive toward Artists Point. We stopped at the Brink of the Upper Falls, but didn’t go all the way to the observation point. It was somewhat steep, and too difficult for us. We then passed Uncle Tom’s Point, which was still closed for construction. It was supposed to be open by September of 2018, but apparently it is taking longer than expected.
Artists Point is one of the busier parts of the part. It is probably the most visited of the Yellowstone Grand Canyon overlooks. The view from here is absolutely incredible. Definitely a primo selfie shot! It’s a good idea to get here early, and definitely be patient. Many people setup camera tripods, and there were only a few “holes” in the prime areas for the rest of us to take pictures. But if you persevere, you will get some great shots.
We are so glad we spent a couple of hours here to enjoy the many exquisite views of Yellowstone Canyon. If you love beautiful scenic views, you’ll love this part of Yellowstone!

places_url_reviews_title: Worth the time to see and hike around
places_url_reviews_comment:

Go see new hotels - they’re very nice, need to upgrade the snow lodge.

places_url_reviews_title: Not to be confused with the Grand Canyon of the Colorado
places_url_reviews_comment: The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone isn't to be confused with the larger and even more magnificent Grand Canyon of the Colorado. But it is big enough and beautiful enough to stir your emotions. Surely, it is one of the most popular attractions in Yellowstone National Park. It is the first large canyon on the Yellowstone River downstream from Yellowstone Falls. It is about 24 miles long, 800 to 1,200 feet in depth and from a quarter-mile to three quarters-of-a-mile wide. Like the Grand Canyon of the Colorado, it is an erosional feature, not a result of glaciation. The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is a classic V-shaped valley, indicative of river-type erosion rather than glaciation. Today, it still is being eroded by the Yellowstone River. Perhaps the most picturesque features of the canyon are the upper and lower falls. But there are other important landmarks, including Agate Creek, Artist Point, Calcite Spring, Cascade Creek, Inspiration Point, Grand View, Lookout Point, Overhanging Cliff, Point Sublime, 7-Mile Hole and Silver Cord Cascade. For ambitious and curious tourists who want to get a closer view of the canyon and the lower falls, perhaps the canyon's most spectacular feature, they are encouraged to tackle the Uncle Tom's Trail, which is a three-mile hike along the steep stairway down the base of the lower falls.

The second day - it was a beautiful sunny day and the shadows and highlights from the sun were simply stunning.
Bit cold and started snowing the day we were there (Sep 24) and some walking to get to the best viewpoints but well worth the cold and snow.
Both the upper and lower falls are spectacular, as is the view of the vast expanse of canyon. Every lookout area provides a new perspective of this incredible site.
Love both sets of Falls! The colors here are indescribable; photos do not even do it justice. The hiking in the area is great. Fairly decent sized parking lots at the venues.

places_url_reviews_title: Beautiful example of the power of natural forces
places_url_reviews_comment: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone has several places you can observe the falls and see somewhat downstream to the depth of the canyon. It is a lovely view of the power of wind, water and the forces of nature.

This is an incredible sight to see. Not only do you want to park and get out to see the lower falls which is crazy beautiful and the water as it rushes over the cliff. Interesting enough, we were told by our National Park Ranger guide that during the winter when it is really cold, these falls actually freeze. The water under the surface still is rushing. Then when it warms up, the frozen ice falls with a loud crash! You also need to stop at another parking lot and see the upper falls which is an awesome. So make sure you stop at both viewing places.
The title says it all really. An impressive canyon, within an impressive area. Not great views form the road, but then, sometimes you have to put a little effort into a trip.

places_url_reviews_title: The Grand Canyon is, um, Grand!
places_url_reviews_comment: No surprise here. The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is absolutely gorgeous and you really should see it if you possibly can. The Grand Canyon in Arizona is even better but who says you should only see one of them?
BEAUTIFUL! I never knew this existed. It is unbelievable. The colors of the wall and the flowing water create a totally awesome experience.
we were told by all park rangers to see this area. they were so right, the canyon walls, the falls and river. every way you looked was impressive site. see the geysers but don't miss this
It is so beautiful it can't be described accurately. The colors alone are stunning, much less the grandeur of the canyon. If you are anywhere near here, you should go!
The most beautiful waterfall I have ever seen. Just a short walk. Very safe and lots of opportunities for great photos. A beautiful place showing God’s creation.
Don't miss this place! It is gorgeous and well worth the trip to go there. The views are outstanding and so picturesque.

This was one of my favorite stops in Yellowstone. It is breath taking. It gets pretty crowded up by the observation points but if you’re patient, you can get up to the railing for a photo. This is a must see for all Yellowstone visitors.

places_url_reviews_title: You have to see it to believe it!
places_url_reviews_comment: The hiking trail to see this wonder was closed, so we drove to Artists Point and walked to the overlook. It just doesn’t look real, and the picture doesn’t look real either.
We are in awe with nature’s beauty when we visit Grand Prismatic Spring in Yellowstone National Park Wyoming.
My husband and I would highly recommend checking out this location. It was a cold and windy morning, we definitely needed more than our light jackets.
Nice are to explore and take light hikes. Some construction at the moment so know before you go. The colors of the canyon and waterfalls are superb.

places_url_reviews_title: Bring a camera and good walking shoes
places_url_reviews_comment: Quick stop on our tour and a short walk upstairs and there's the Lower Falls. Worth the side trip to see its beauty.
Beautiful canyon - make sure to walk to all the viewpoints to see different views of it. I was surprised to find that even in mid September there were still crowds here.

places_url_reviews_title: Must see Grand Canyon of Yellowstone
places_url_reviews_comment: This was the most beautiful site to hike and see. Waterfalls, geologic wonder, and much more. We hiked both the south and north rims on different days. Arrive early 8 or 9 am to get a parking spot. By 10 am you will be waiting. Enjoy a sample of our pic

The Grand Canyon was interesting to see, especially the volcanic rock formations. It was smoky and overcast the day that we were there, and I think the view may have been more majestic if the weather had been better.
This is a must for any visitor to Yellowstone. The majestic waterfall is an amazing sight. The views are awesome.
There is some walking to get to Inspirational Point but it is worth the view. We have gone to the Grand Canyon and our opinion we like this better. BEAUTIFUL
Nice view of water fall. Liked the south rim for the best views. Uncle toms Cabin area was closed but all other areas were great.

We have seen this before but it never ceases to amaze. So many different vantage points if you drive along the rims. We have also done the nine mile hike down to the canyon floor but did not have time on this trip.
There is much to do here. You can park in the lot and take a short walk to see the views or hike down steep trails to see even more stunning views. Worth the trip

It depends on where you are at but the views are fantastic and if you travel correctly you will end up at the top of the falls . Now go the other way and you can get fantastic photos of the falls and the canyon too.
Just Pretty!!

This is a MUST SEE on a Yellowstone visit. The view from
Artist's Point is breathtaking. One of the highlights of our five days in Yellowstone.
We were here the 2nd week of September and the views were spectacular - not as crowded as during peak times. A must see if you go to YSNP, easy walk to see the falls.

places_url_reviews_title: You can't go to YSNP without stopping here!!!!
places_url_reviews_comment: I have been a visitor to Yellowstone since 1972 and never tire of this view, taking the walks or taking gazillions of photos over the years! Don't miss it!!!

During peak times this is horribly congested but it is so for a reason. Viewed from both the North and South rims the lower falls are beautiful. Coming to Yellowstone in mid September I was not expecting the falls to be so full. They must be even more impressive earlier in the year. Artists point was my favourite point to see the view.
Whilst the focus is on the falls, the canyon itself is spectacular with its steep sides and colourful variety in the rocks.

A nice easy walk to get to it. You can hike to an area right in front of the falls. Both the falls are amazing .
Parking is an issue at both places
Restrooms are there .
Canyon village is nearby for food .

This part of the Yellowstone Park is completely different than the part you expect (all the Geysirs and colorful pools), but it is still very beautiful. There are several waterfalls, you can hike there. Parking is always possible, even during August it was not difficult to find a spot there.

places_url_reviews_title: forget old faithful- spend your time here!
places_url_reviews_comment: The most impressive thing I saw in yellowstone. although not as big as the grand grand canyon it is just as awesome. there are plenty of trails down to offer different perspectives of the river and waterfall. great colors not to be missed! worth waiting for the crazy parking.

We are senior citizens who had never seen the Old Faithful Geyser. The auto trip that we took from Florida to see this wonderful event was well worth it. We had purchased several years ago The National Parks and Federal Recreational Lands Pass so we were able to get into the park without paying an extra fee. We have the Senior Pass. We got to the site where Old Faithful would make a show for all to see. There were may seats available around the area yet people had to sit on the concrete at our feet due to the crowd waiting for the Geyser to erupt. When it erupted on time, the display went on for about three minutes. It was wonderful!
Other things that we was were people fishing in the streams, people watching other eruptions in several other spots in the park, and last but not least a bison walking up the side of the road.

places_url_reviews_title: Lots of spots to stop and view the canyon
places_url_reviews_comment:
No need to walk the rim, lots of spots to stop. We did the north rim trail and it was mostly in the trees. Nice hike, but the views from the view points were much better. Save the legs for other sites.
Worth noting, in an RV it is hard to find parking at all of the viewpoints. Best to view in a car.

It’s hard to describe how beautiful the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone truly is. It is nothing short of spectacular. If you’re up for it, hike down to the updated viewing deck, or stay up high on the north rim and take in the majestic view.

It is worth driving to Canyon Village and visiting the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. I would strongly recommend to use the South Rim Drive to have the best spot to take the best pictures of the waterfalls.

Gorgeous! A nice easy walk to get to it. The sun was starting to set so we got some great pictures. And we drove around to the other side and it was a totally different perspective. You can hike to an area right in front of the falls. We didn’t do the hike but saw people doing it. Just beautiful
So beautiful, I could have stayed and looked all around for hours. Loved the hikes down and up. Parking was easily available, great pathways.
Not quite as spectacular as the actual Grand Canyon but cool to see. Worth seeing from both the upper and lower sections.

This is a really impressive canyon. The light color of the canyon against the greenish water from the powerfull Lower Falls is amazing. There are several lookout points to view the Yellowstone canyon. Best lookouts are 'Lookout point' at the North Rim and 'Artist Point' at he South Rim.
This is a really great location with wonderful views of the canyon and falls. I would go pack again as the view will change with the seasons.
Parking can be competitive, but the views are magnificent. Part of the loop was closed when we were there, so I cannot speak to the lower falls views.
While this is not as spectacular as the Grand Canyon itself, it is a beautiful sight and a gorgeous view. It is at the same lot as the stop for the Lower Falls so you get two great views!

places_url_reviews_title: great hikes and best views in the park
places_url_reviews_comment: I'd put this in the top three of Yellowstone sights. Wildlife watching in the Lamar and Hayden valleys, the geysers and this. We did a couple of short but somewhat difficult hikes to get better views of the falls and the canyon, but there are plenty of good spots that are very easily accessible and provide great views of the canyon. This is obviously a can't miss attraction in the park.
Not to be missed. Beautiful vistas on both sides or f the canyon and a great hike to the head of one of the falls

I’m glad we visited in September after the crowds. Not many families mostly couples or tours of older folks. The weather was spectacular! Withstanding hiking, we could have seen all the highlights in two days. Old Faithful did not disappoint. I wasn’t sure I cared about seeing but it really was a thrill. Nice area to stop at.
Painters pots were interesting, the canyons, Hayden and Lamar valleys for wildlife. We went to Lamar valley at sunrise and it was beautiful. Didn’t see the wolves, however but they were there the day before. Mammoth springs were interesting and the area has a decent restaurant. Drove several miles back there another day to have breakfast.
Easy access in the park with beautiful view. I recommend this as a stopping point on any park adventure.

Worth your time-get there early and hike to at least Point Sublime from Artists Point. I highly recommend the South Rim Trail to Clear Lake
!

The Yellowstone is the longest free flowing river in the lower 48 and it did a magnificent job carving this canyon. The falls thunder and the canyon walls display a dazzling array of colors. Visit early morning for the best light and to avoid the crowds.
Everything can be manage with a car, but parking lots are totaly full and must waiting for it. Therefore is better park a car in one place and walk along the rim.

Call something “Grand Canyon” and you expect something wonderful. While this is not on the scale of its namesake it is a beautiful place to visit. View it from Artist Point in the morning to make the most of the sun and you will not be disappointed.

The views of the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone and the falls are certainly worth visiting. We saw the falls from two different sides of the canyon on the morning of our trip.
Go as early as possible to avoid the crowds and the tour buses.

places_url_reviews_title: Step into a fine art painting
places_url_reviews_comment:
Yellowstone is one of the most amazing places on the planet, and its Grand Canyon is stunningly beautiful.
There are several viewing platform areas - take the time to check them all out. Each one gives a different perspective and angle. The sheer size of the canyon, coupled with the drama of fast-falling water, plus the unusual color of the rock walls make this a must-see. See if you can spot a few small steam vents in the canyon walls.
There's a great, short video on the NPS site about the falls. It contains excellent, concise information that will aide you before your visit.
In a huge, must-see national park filled with must-see attractions, I can see why some might miss this one. If, like most people, you enter YNP from the south gate and travel, clockwise, you will have to travel a bit to get to the canyon. Ideally, it will be your second or third day of your visit.
Do not miss out. If you enjoy nature (which is why we visit Yellowstone, right?) take the time to see this part. While the thermal features are like visiting another planet, the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is one of the most beautiful parts of this planet.

Be wary of arriving at busy times as car-parks fill and there can be hordes of other tourists at the key viewing spots. Both sides are very attracrtive and for those of us keen on geology and geography, very interesting too. A must-do on a sweep on the Great Loop Road
Easy stop and hike along the North Rim Drive of the Canyon. As everything else in the Park... beautiful views and sights.

places_url_reviews_title: Interesting surreal yellow colorization of the canyon walls
places_url_reviews_comment: Unlike the Grand Canyon in Arizona which appears red in comparison, the canyon walls of the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is yellow in color. With some of the exposed rock in black color, it makes for an interesting and surreal image, almost like looking at a painting. Also, the Grand Canyon in Yellowstone is closer to the observation viewpoints, which gives it a more intimate feeling. This is a must see attraction. Both the Lookout Point on the North Rim Drive and the Artist Point on the South Rim Drive offers great vantage points of both the Lower Falls and the Canyon. The Calcite Springs Overlook also offers a great vantage point for just the Canyon itself and is less crowded.

Not as spectacular as the Grand Canyon, but definitely worth visiting. Stunning views and gorgeous scenery. I visited during the Memorial Day weekend, and the park was pretty crowded, so patience was required to be able to take photos.

You don't want to miss the views from Artist Point on the South Rim or Inspiration Point on the North Rim. Both give awesome views of the waterfalls and the canyon walls. You will be able to see why the place is called Yellowstone.

At the desk of the hotel we were asked if we had seen the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone,when we said we hadn’t we were told not to miss it. They were right! It was absolutely beautiful. So happy we didn’t miss it!

one more can't miss place to visit when in Yellowstone National Park...attraction is easy to get to and offers some really nice picture taking opportunities....may not be as "Grand" as the one in AZ but it's close...awesome place....

Know that there is no singular view of the canyon and falls that is better than another. They are all stunning. You will also never see the exact view of the Moran painting because it is a compilation of views. Bring your hiking boots. Hike the north lower falls trails and do it at dawn. No one will be there and your drive through the park to get to the canyon will be unmatched. Steam rising everywhere, fog patches, foraging animals, and then the hike down to the crest of the falls. The mist at dawn catches sunlight and reflects colors from the walls. Hike the northern rim after - its relatively flat. You’ll mostly be alone or meet a couple of other dawn enthusiasts.

places_url_reviews_title: can take a look if you have time
places_url_reviews_comment: The most attractive region in the Yellowstone (I think) is the geothermal region, however, the canyon region is worth to go to take a look if you have time, it takes you at least half fay (4 hrs) or even longer if you walk many trails. The most impressive in this canyon region is the Lower falls, the colorful (red, orange and white) cliff wall may be also somewhat attractive.
We visited the different rims along the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone and hiked down the lower falls which is paved.
Do NOT miss this stop on your Yellowstone vacation! Amazing views! Steep hiking down. But just take your time. Definitely a must see!

places_url_reviews_title: Not the Grand Canyon but very nice.
places_url_reviews_comment: This is on a much smaller scale than the Grand Canyon of course but offers nice views of Canyon and waterfalls and some good walks around the area which take in lakes and some thermal features. Some of the south rim areas were closed when we were there but the trail from Wapati trailhead to Ribbon Lake is a good one to do. The driving route on the north rim offers a number of good viewpoints too.
This is a must see in the park. There are many hiking trails from easy to more moderately strenuous and the views are breathtaking.

This place was absolutely amazing. The trail down to the lower falls is a little steep, so be prepared to take a few breaks on the way back up. Also, I wouldn't suggest wearing a hat as the wind blows hard. I saw several people hats get blown off and fall down the mountain.
Put this on your list of things to do!

places_url_reviews_title: Better than the real Grand Canyon
places_url_reviews_comment: This is absolutely beautiful and more on a level that you can visually comprehend than the real Grand Canyon. I wasn’t a fan when we visited two years ago but this was different. Far more beautiful and exciting to see. We loved it!
One of the most beautiful sites I've ever seen! Our tour guides were awesome and told us a lot about how this Grand Canyon came about. Highly recommend.

The Grand Canyon here of course is nothing like the Grand Canyon in Arizona - it's much narrower, more like a deep gorge, but the view is spectacular nevertheless. The river is a much more brilliant green next to the amazingly colorful palette of the Canyon walls. There are many lookout points on both north and south rims. Stop at all of them if you have the time, but if not, here are 3 of my favorites:
Artist Point - on the south rim, gives you a sweeping, distant view of the falls. Tends to get overcrowded so best to go early or late in the day. For more solitude and more views of the Canyon hike a bit on the Point Sublime trail (look for the sign marked Ribbon Lake). Trail is a mile one way but no need to go all the way as the best views are half way in.
Brink of Lower Falls - right off the north rim drive, requires a very steep hike down and up (0.75 miles one way) to the viewing platform. A must see if you like standing almost next to the bottom of a huge thundering waterfall.
Brink of Upper Falls - Off the loop road just south of the north rim drive - not far from the parking lot, just a few steps down. We stopped here as a last minute add on at the end of the day but it was totally worth it. Nothing like being right next to a raging river rushing towards the lip of the fall. If you like the deafening noise of water plunging down this is a good spot to be.
In addition to the Canyon and falls, we also found the stretch of the loop road between Tower and Canyon junctions to have the best bear sightings. Two in one day - grizzly and black bear with cub!
Spectacular views of the waterfall and canyon! Truly beautiful, so it's no wonder artists have flocked here to paint it!

Short walk to overlooks. Incredible views. Unfortunately there was some Smokey haze that day. There was a small grizzly on the path going to the right so we didn't go there! Others did. With their kids. Then a ranger came, thank god. Take the pull off and visit this place.
Certainly worth stopping at the various overlooks high above the roaring river below. The canyon changes color throughout the day dependent on the angle of the sun. Cool!

Really one of Yellowstone's to do. The canyon has two rims. Definitely both rims deserve a visit. The same way it is a good idea to walk along the trails on both rims of the canyon. Marvellous sights.
This was a beautiful place to visit! Our visit was included with our group tour and this was so nice and we are so glad we stopped here.

We spent 10 day in Yellowstone and spent time in the Grand Canyon area as well as other parts of the park. The falls were so breathtaking as were the canyon areas. Make sure to hike around the falls to get the full experience.

Amazing scenery, waterfalls, and pleasant walks on well developed trails.I have been to Yellowstone several times before without ever seeing the Grand Canyon portion of the park, and it is worth whatever time it takes to get to it!

It was great view and totally different view from the lower level but we enjoyed very much to see some bears, buffalo and some elks and deers. We also hired the same tour bus took us to visit the upper level park it that was also a smart move otherwise you would driven over 150 miles again and would not enjoyed the rides
Part of our tour included this area which was very scenic. The depths of the canyons is amazing. If in Yellowstone you at least need to drive by.

places_url_reviews_title: Excellent area of Yellowstone-not to be missed
places_url_reviews_comment: This is a very busy area of Yellowstone and parking is at a premium. Take extra caution driving around parking areas. The scenery here is breathtaking to say the least.
One of the most memorable stops of our trip. A short walk from the parking, totally worth it! Pics do not do it justice

places_url_reviews_title: A little effort for a big reward!
places_url_reviews_comment: Seeing the canyon and falls from all of the different vantage points is worth the time and the energy to walk down into the canyon. Every angle shows something different, and there are plenty of places to stop and catch your breath on the walk back up out of the canyon.
Plus animals: we saw several deer with big antlers. Earlier we saw a doe with a fawn. The park does a great job of showing the waterfalls from a good vantage point.

If you are in the park and do NOT visit this site, you might as well stayed home. Inspiring and awesome at the same time. The geo-thermal part of the park is outstanding, but so are these sites. Take them in!!
Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is a must visit. The stunning beautify of both the waterfalls and the surrounding areas cannot be adequately described or pictured. They are a must see.
Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is definitely a must see stop. Many opportunities to view waterfalls. We used the Gypsy app which pointed out where all the stops were and we didn't miss anything.

I visited Yellowstone National Park with Cosmos tours.
Every spot of Yellowstone is wonderful including Nature, History and Geology.
Don't miss the great view from Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone on your visit.
By far the best place to visit in Yellowstone. Very photogenic. There are so many places to stop to enjoy the views along with several short trails

places_url_reviews_title: Many places to stop along the Raod
places_url_reviews_comment: Great places along the road to view the canyon and take pictures. Many water falls and fantastic views. We rented a car in Cody, Wy., so we would not have to drive the RV in tight places and miss some of the places to stop.

I was blown away the second I walked to an overlook to observe the canyons and the falls. It is rich in geological formation and dramatic cliffs so you want to stay off the edge. The Artists Paint Pots are in a category of their own offering a backdrop that you cannot even find in an art gallery. This is a must see if you visit Yellowstone.

places_url_reviews_title: Do both the South Rim and the North Rim.
places_url_reviews_comment: On the South Rim you can see Artists Point with a view on the Lower Falls. Too bad Inspiration Point and Old Tom's Trail are closed. On the North Rim you can see the Upper Falls. You need a day to see it all. As it is very crowded here, go and see this early in the morning or after 3PM (as we did).

places_url_reviews_title: Unquestionably a highlight of the park - DON'T MISS
places_url_reviews_comment: Extraordinary part of Yellowstone. This is one of the most stunningly beautiful places in Yellowstone. Trail along the rim is terrific. Views are incredible.
The amazing Canyon with the different colours and geological formations must be seen from different places in the rout.

This side of the park is completely different than the geysers and hot springs. The canyon is beautiful and both the falls are breathtaking. As with EVERY part of Yellowstone park, there are not enough parking spots anywhere for all the guests of the park.
The upper and lower falls are very impressive. A good break from geysers and hot springs. Take the hike down to the brink of the lower falls!
My husband recently passed away so my children and I went to honor him. Our favorite place in the park even better than Old Faithful in my opinion
Grand canyon of the yellow stone amazing place to see. Just sit relax and take it in. Photo can never do the justification to the beauty of this place. Take a hike and view some more.

Definitely do the short steep hike to the Brink to Lower falls. It has lots of people on the trail and feels safe. Take time coming up and enjoy the views. Powerful to stand next to them. Then be sure to see the Brink of upper falls which is an easy short walk from parking lot. And finally Artist Point has some amazing views across the canyon to see the falls. Disappointed Uncle Tom’s trails down the canyon side was closed due to construction but if you visit these 3 spots you can still see it all. Stop by Falls cafe for burger fries and a shake at the Canyons.
Beautifull hike, starting around Uncle Tom / Artist Point. where you have a superb view over the Grand Canyon from YellowStone...!

I would recommend doing Artist Point on the South Rim first thing in the morning to avoid long waiting lines (for parking) and crowded platforms (tourists buses come in in hoards). Artist Point has undoubtedly the best view of the canyon, and is one of the most photographed spots in the park.
After that do the North Rim, which is usually less crowded. The North Rim has great hikes with various entry points along the Rim. The hikes range from I would say 1-2 miles - so they’re short, but relatively steep. We did it with 10 and 12-yr old boys, and they were completely fine doing the trails. We saw people of all ages going the trails.
The first is a trail to the Brink of the Lower Falls - this takes you right to the top of the Falls where it comes down. Amazing view to see such enormous volume to water gushing down the canyon. From here, you can either walk down to the next trail (this walk is a trail in itself), or drive to the next stop. Here, there’s a Grand View (right at the entrance of the trail - view is ok, not great). From here there’s a Red Rock trail going down. This is probably the best trail on the North Rim, pretty good views of the Canyon.
All in all, doing the South and North Rim with the hikes should take around two hours, maybe slightly longer depending on your hiking speed and the time you spend at the viewing platforms.
Breathtakingly beautiful! Surprisingly easy to get to and wonderful hikes along the canyon that get more spectacular as you hike!!!

places_url_reviews_title: Most beautiful spot in the park
places_url_reviews_comment: The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone was the most beautiful spot in the park in my opinion. The views were sensational. The scenery was well worth making the trip to see. You can hike to multiple viewing spots. If you go to Yellowstone, don't miss coming her.

Truly an amazing experience. We went to the viewing point where the falls were in the distance......you get a great grasp of the scope of the area. Then, we walked down to the top of the falls........AMAZING....the roar of the water rushing over the rocks was so loud! The way down is easy......of course......the way back up is UP.....and UP......but they have places to rest at almost every switchback so take it slow and easy and advantage of them but don't miss the viewpoint. Shady most of the way and footing is pretty easy and level. I appreciated my hiking shoes but tennis shoes work too. Plenty of bathrooms and also plenty of people so be patient......but GO!

Amazing views can be found from either the North Rim or the South Rim of the Canyon. If you stay at Canyon Lodge, there is an easy path through the woods to walk over to the North Rim so you don’t have to fight over parking.
