enjoyed our walk down to the falls -- not the return trip so much -- and the power of the falls, especially the lower one. Access from south side closed for improvement, but drove to the end of the road for a great view up the valley.

If you have a passion for what nature creates, you would not want miss this. Not only did the Yellowstone River create this canyon, but waterfalls you have to see to believe. Upper and lower falls take a little hiking to get to but well worth it.

places_url_reviews_title: GC of Yellowstone a beautiful canyon.
places_url_reviews_comment: There are many views of the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone on the loop road that takes you to the viewpoints for the upper and lower Yellowstone falls. These are right near Canyon Village in NW Yellowstone. It's a great road with places to park and view the river/falls/canyon.

The best advice I have is this should be on your bucket list and you should make sure to check it out.
Warning though is never push your luck by getting too close the the edge the fall is real bad from that height.
the Doctor show me some LOVE ❤️Hit me with a Helpful VOTE!
Great trails, lots of benches to rest. The view is just beautiful. Go in September - I cannot imagine how crowded it is during the summer.

Hikes were fantastic and well marked. The views were spectacular. There was construction on some of the trails but it honestly didn’t even matter. Washrooms were accessible and parking was decent too.

places_url_reviews_title: Not comparable to the famous one but also interesting
places_url_reviews_comment: You should visit the falls and the different scenic views there. You'll get a much more close look to the canyon than in Grand Canyon National Park because it's very narrow and not so deep. The main spots are good to reach with the car. Just only a view steps to the platforms.
There are a lot of great sites around this area. It definitely is a must see if you’re in the area! Make sure to use the pull offs.
This view is absolutely amazing but was very crowded when we stopped by midday. Well worth the stop.

places_url_reviews_title: Beautiful but quite a hike to see it 600' down and up.
places_url_reviews_comment: Beautiful but quite a hike to see it 600' down and up. It is worth it if you are fit. The views of the area are spectacular.
You definitely should not miss this lovely sight while visiting Yellowstone. The view of the canyon and the waterfall are spectacular.

On the day we visited Canyon Village/Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone included an additional unexpected bonus as it snowed the night before. We had beautiful 'winter wonderland' views in the morning, then as it warmed up and the clouds opened up, we had equally nice 'Fall' viewing!
If there is snow, just be prepared for slippery conditions on the switchbacks until the snow and slush is gone.
Hint: Always carry a case of water and cooler of food items anytime you are in the park because the weather/road conditions can change quickly. Also keep extra clothing on hand just in case. We would love to come back here again.

You must drive up to Canyon Village. It's a nice walk down to the viewing stations. The views are breathtaking. Between watching the waterfalls and the deep rich canyon, this is one of the reasons why you came to Yellowstone. It's worth every step back up. It's a bit steep but know you can rest every few steps.
This is really a beautiful view The colors of the water and the canyon walls are fantastic.. There are plenty of spots to pull over and see it .
The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is a must visit attraction in the Yellowstone National Park. The colors of the soil in the mountains and the kind of green running water is an spectacular view.

places_url_reviews_title: Being there is better than pictures!
places_url_reviews_comment: We were told to make sure and see this by a photographer in Cody WY. He was right it was worth the time. Absolutely beautiful.
There are three trails start at the 1st hnearest the falls and then walk to the next. Youl will get a few miles end by end of the day and the sights are worth it.

This place is one you must see to really appreciate. It is beyond words to explain the beauty of the area. It takes at least three days to see the area. The Yellowstone River and the rock formations are breathtaking as is the whole area of the park.

The 20 miles of canyon created by the yellowstone river in its 600 miles of turbulent journey is one of the highlights of the visit. While its geology is not clearly understood, its clearly a much loved stop. We braved biting cold temperatures to trek the trails to see the views.
Don't know how we've missed this on prior trips, but a real highlight this time. Do yourself a favor and look up Thomas Moran's paintings before you go to see what he captured there.

We drove along the edge of the canyon, stopping at all the vantage points for different views of this splendid natural attraction...just breathtaking! We did not take the hike to view the falls from below so I can't comment on the hike or view from there. Be sure to spend some time enjoying this when you visit.

I knew little about the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone and was surprised by the beauty and grandeur of this section of the park. It was absolutely beautiful and worth the various short hikes to access breathtaking views from a variety of vantage points.

The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is one of the most visited destinations in the park. This is for good reason. The views of the canyon are simply amazing, and there is nothing else like it. The Yellowstone River, combined with unique volcanic activity, has created a very interesting canyon with rock formations and colors that are unlike anything else I've seen.
There are roads that go along the upper rim and part of the lower rim. There's plenty of parking on the upper rim, so you can stop at various places to walk and take pictures. I recommend hiking down to the brink of the lower falls and lookout point.
Construction at the time prevented us from reaching Inspiration Point, but it likely had a similar view to the other locations we did see.
Bottom line: Be sure to check out the Grand Canyon when in Yellowstone.

I've been to the Grand Canyon and the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone and they are both awesome - amazing for different reasons. This one is so dramatic and Yellowstone falls looks incredible as it flows fiercely all year round. Is easy to get to, just check your park map when you arrive, and parking is easy - it's a very short walk to the overlook (look for 'artists point' on south rim drive). Would definitely recommend this as one of Yellowstone's best attractions. If you want to see it from a different perspective, you can do a very steep, but fair short hike to the top of the lower falls (take lower falls trail from north rim drive). It's important to note these two different views are on opposite sides of the Canyon - chittenden bridge will take you over the river.

We travel here in September and while there were still plenty of people, it wasn't excessive and I must say that the scenery is worth it. There are many spot to view the canyon and the Yellowstone river. Stop at as many as you can!

Canyons, waterfalls, steamy jets, pine trees, interesting rocks! This is a place with a variety of stunning scenes. Bring your camera! There was a ranger there giving a lecture on wolves which we happened upon. Most interesting. Don't miss this area!

We were on a Road Scholar trip for six days and saw so many wonderful sights. Every person interested in the beauty of the natural wonders of our world should visit Yellowstone National Park. I'm going to give almost every site in the park a 5.

places_url_reviews_title: Get there early morning to see the sunrise and the wonderful effects
places_url_reviews_comment: This is a brilliant place to visit. It has breathtaking views but can get very crowded with coaches etc and plenty of Chinese visitors Go early before the bulk arrive or after six in the evening but make sure you go

Whilst being amazed at everything else Yellowstone has to offer, we were so surpised at the is extra gem. The Grand Canyon of yellowstone and the falls are excellent and well worth the visit notwithstanding the plethora of tourists.

places_url_reviews_title: Beautiful, unique, a must see in Yellowstone, BUT...
places_url_reviews_comment:
The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is one of the "Must Sees" in Yellowstone.
BUT... be sure to check on what is currently open to the public. We were there in August 2017. Several roads and/or view points/trailheads were closed for either improvement or repair.

One of the most stunningly beautiful places on the planet. Alas, it's hard to appreciate in a crowd of several hundred+ people. Try anyway. Early morning or late evening are best times to avoid crowds, although photography light is best mid-day.
Beautiful and scenic area of Yellowstone National Park. Excellent signage. Good parking. Paved walking path to overlooks. Bathrooms near the parking lots.
Probably our most favorite part of our Yellowstone trip (other than the wildlife). The Yellowstone River and the falls were very beautiful. The pictures seen beforehand did not bring it justice.

This was a highlight of our trip. Some group members did along hike while others just enjoyed the view from the top. There is something for everyone and lots of parking. Washrooms were dirty but available.

Words cannot express the beauty and power of this location in Yellowstone National Park. If we had ignored the little signs for the Brink of Upper Falls it would have been a big mistake. I can't imagine this would be unnoticeable from about a half a mile away. Do not miss both the Lower Falls and the Upper Falls. They are truly spectacular.

Take your time and stop to enjoy all what nature has to show.
Great views awesome , spectaller, capture

places_url_reviews_title: A beautful loocation and sight to see.
places_url_reviews_comment: This is a must see in the Park. There are several locations to view and all are worth a visit. If you get there in the morning at the right time a rainbow appears from the falls is wonderful to photograph.

places_url_reviews_title: Thor Grand Canyon at West Yellowstone
places_url_reviews_comment: This is another beautiful place to see and hike in West Yellowstone. Don't stop at the very beginning with the waterfall, continue around to the path and walk up! The views are simply stunning and the hike is not that difficult. You can stop anywhere along the way to just gaze out at this natural beauty that God gave us. My husband hiked to the very end of the trail but didn't feel the views were any more enticing for the last 1/2 mile. Simply lovely
I wish the weather had been better on the day I was there but it was still beautiful despite the rain and snow. Gorgeous view!

So the classic view is from Artists point, and it is a great one. Best light in early am, but closer to noon better chance to catch a rainbow from the spray of the falls.. Hikes into the canyon only go down so far, but offer great views of the brink of the lower falls and from the red rock observation point. Both are recommended. Hard to pick out a favorite spot at Yellowstone but this would be right up at the top.
Deep and noisy were my first impressions. The colors were amazing and we learned that the yellow rock gave Yellowstone it's iconic name.
Yellowstone is a must see for all! This loop road is fantastic. The Park is a true American treasure. Don't miss it.

The view of the falls was one of the drivers for designating the park - the iconic painting.
The view from the South Rim Drive walkway is excellent and just what you would expect.
As per usual the walks are very well maintained and easy to traverse.
Unfortunately Inspiration Point was close this late in the season - sad.
North Rim Drive has an excellent alternate view from Grand View. Worth the drive and stop.

places_url_reviews_title: Easy access point. Lots of parking and a short walk to the viewing levels.
places_url_reviews_comment: Stopped here twice. Once in the afternoon and took pictures. Then the next day early in the morning for the sunrise. What a difference the sunlight makes. It is amazing the colors you see in the morning.

There ;are so many wonderful things to see and experience in Yellowstone, but this is definitely one of the top places to see. The roaring waterfalls are just beautiful, powerful and the canyon is gorgeous. Mother nature at her best! There are the upper and lower falls, both with boardwalks and viewing areas. Don't miss this.
A must see in Yellowstone! The falls are fantastic and the canyon is so impressive. You can get some great photos here.
Two beautiful drives; one on each side of the canyon. Beautiful views, trails and waterfalls. Many pull-out points. If you are at all interested in geology or just like beauty, you must come
Stunning scenery. Some access points currently closed for maintenance, but still plenty accessible viewpoints. Many stunning aspect to Yellowstone, but this is a must see.
My number-one, MUST-see area of Yellowstone. Easy hike to see the falls with a nice viewing area available. Make time to see this area when visiting Yellowstone

What a beautiful and powerful waterfall. The views from both sides of canyon are amazing. You will have to walk a short ways to see from all overlooks. Be sure to stop at all the overlooks and be amazed.

places_url_reviews_title: Five Stars... but get there early!
places_url_reviews_comment: The GC of Yellowstone was our most anticipated stop on our three day trip to the park. The beauty and grandness of this place deserved 5 stars, no question. This was our first stop of the day, arriving before 10 am. All was good. By 11:15 the place was a madhouse. Tour buses bringing loads of travelers packing the trails and walkways. Regardless of your park destination, my advice is to get there as early as possible. We found that by early afternoon we were ready to be free of the crowds. Do notice warnings before walking down to the observations decks as this is a very tough return back to the top. Was hoping the end of August was going to be a bit quieter. We still had a blast!

A must see. There are lots of ways to see this feature, one two different sides. Far away from the falls themselves or right over the falls. Beautiful waterfall and river below. Beautiful walls of rock and pine trees. A picture moment.
Its gigantic, colorful and fantastic with a majestic waterfall. Loved the colorful scenery with a superb viewpoint

places_url_reviews_title: This Is A Must See In Yellowstone
places_url_reviews_comment: I missed the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone 6 years ago but will tell everyone that this is a must see. It is gorgeous! You must see it from every angle and bring your camera you will want to tell all your friends to go and see it too.
This is a wonderful place to stop while in Yellowstone. The scenery is colorful and fantastic. From Artists Point, one can take a shot of the Yellowstone Falls, which is truly magnificent.

places_url_reviews_title: ~~ Yes, it's BEAUTIFUL but I think the geyser basins are more spectacular! ~~
places_url_reviews_comment:
Having been to the Grand Canyon in Arizona it is very easy to see why this area of Yellowstone has the same name. It is absolutely incredible that there is such diversity in this park and a canyon is just one of many.
The parking lot is big so plenty of room. It was pouring with rain the day we visited but the place was still packed with tourists. The main viewing area, like many in the Grand Canyon of Arizona, was CROWDED so you had to wait to get a good picture etc.
Easy walk from the parking lot to viewing areas and of course the Falls can be seen here too. Glad we saw it but we were wowed more by some of the other sights.

We visited Yellowstone as part of a small group tour and visited the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone toward the end of three day stay. We found the view awe inspiring. The vast scale of the canyon took us completely by surprise. It was, without doubt, the most impressive thing we saw in the park even though we loved so many other aspects of this amazing place. You really can't afford to miss this viewpoint if you are visiting Yellowstone National Park.

This was a beautiful waterfall in a canyon. The canyon walls are multi colored. Go at sunset or sunrise for amazing scenes and less people. Very crowded. Seeing from a location you can hike to with less people would be better.
If you are going to see the falls you will see the canyon. It is very beautiful and well worth the time to enjoy it.

This is a must see! One of the most beautiful canyons complete with waterfalls in America. This is the heart of Yellowstone! Pick up a National Park Service Canyon Trail Guide before you go. It would not be a complete visit without doing at least a couple of trails. On the south rim Uncle Tom's was closed for construction. The South Rim Trail offers beautiful canyon views, but limited views of the Falls, but you must go to Artist Point. On the North Rim the Red Rock Point Trail offers incredible views of the Falls but is very steep.

places_url_reviews_title: Easy to See How the Park Earned its Name
places_url_reviews_comment:
This Canyon is indeed Grand. . . and the walls covered in an array of colors were the source of the name "Yellowstone" bestowed on the park. They do throw off brilliant shades of yellows, oranges, browns, pinks, etc. and contrasted next to the blues/greens of water, sky and foliage it is easy to see why overlooks have names like Inspiration Point, Artists Point, etc.
This area is less known than Old Faithful but just as, well, Grand.
Definitely worth a visit -- drive the upper and lower canyon roads (or hike the trails) to take in the overlooks.
Stunning beyond words. Incredible beauty all around. Lots of viewing points and trails to walk. Car parking can be a problem.

Breathtakingly spectacular! Just one of so many outstanding natural things to see in the park! It was one of my personal favorites. We stayed nearby at the Canyon Lodge in a perfect location and were able to see other fantastic venues in one day as a result. Wonderful trip!
Try to arrive in early evening ,by then some of the tour bus visitors will have gone and you can see the falls as a ribbon of gold.Keep an eye open for the multi coloured sides of valley

I'd heard so much about Yellowstone, but not about the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. What a great surprise! It was just gorgeous! I've seen other beautiful canyons, but not with the colors of this one! The waterfalls were beautiful, as was the river. My favorite spot was Artist Point-- unbelievably beautiful. It was all easily visited, with roads, walkways, lookout points and trails.
By far one of my favorite spots at Yellowstone! Beautiful views of the waterfall and the canyons. All the views are only a short walk but very busy location!

places_url_reviews_title: Take the time to hike along the trails.
places_url_reviews_comment: There are several areas where you can park and walk out to see the canyon and the waterfalls and they are all worth the effort. They are mostly level and the views make them easy to handle. Each section has a different view of the canyon and/or the river, so try to make time to stop at each one. Like everything in the park, parking can get to be a problem at these popular stops, so try to go early or later in the day if you can. If not, just make another loop, chances are good that someone will be leaving and open up a space.
You need to see this! OMG! The water fall is amazing and the rock formation is incredible! It can be very crowded and parking may be an issue, but do not miss this!

places_url_reviews_title: Spectacular; however limited your time in Yellowstone, go here!
places_url_reviews_comment: Although not of the same scale as the Grand Canyon in Arizona; this compact canyon with it s glorious waterfall is still extensive and beautiful with a glorious viewpoint from artist's viewpoint.

The views are amazing of the falls and the canyon. We drove both upper and lower and walked up the trail to take pictures. It was an easy walk in and back and well worth it. One evening after dinner we drove back on the lower falls drive and saw lots of wildlife.

A really beaitiful place with accessible trails. Would be useful to have more sogns though so it is easier to know where to go exactly as we parked in the first parking lot, not realizing that there was a second one that was closer to the trail that we wanted to do.

This is one of the best sights in Yellowstone. The canyon was created by the glaciers and the river while the gorgeous colors are related to the iron in the rock. There is a very lovely walk on a trail at the southern rim leading to the falls. On another day we drove on the northern side, then hiked close to the rim and the views were spectacular there also. This is a natural feature of Yellowstone National Park that cannot be missed. Go early to beat the hordes.

This is a spectaculter place to see...the colors of the Canyon are beautiful and a must hike is to the top overlooks and down in to view both the Upper Falls and the Lower Falls....both falls are spectacular as well as the Canyon.
So beautiful! Artist point is a must. Brink of lower and upper falls is a lot of fun! Do the red rock trail in order to get an awesome view of lower falls! I wish uncle toms trail would of been open!

Of all the things to see in Yellowstone, the canyon is my favorite. The colors, the river, the falls - it's all beautiful. The hike to the brink of the lower falls is well worth the effort. Use caution - the trail is in need of maintenance. Some of the railings are broken and/or missing.
Visited the grand canyon ...this mini one is also stunning well worth a visit the view and sight is amazing the waterfall and river that was a bonus

We stopped and did the very short walk to see the Lower (I think) waterfall. The view is spectacular. Only 'problem' is the amateur photographers with piles of equipment that seem to think it's their right to take all the best viewing places and stay there for a long time.
Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone did not disappoint. Make sure you make it to Artist Point. The bring of the upper falls was outstanding.

The hype is an understatement when it comes to the GC of YS. Be sure to go to the visitors center to see the geological history of YS. Then make all the stops along the canyon rim, north and south. Hike down to the bottom and along the rim. See magnificent vistas, hear the roaring waterfalls and rapids, see the osprey nest sitting atop a pinnacle of rock, hold hands and say I love you Celebrate your 50th wedding anniversary! No better place.
We didn't realize there was such an amazingly beautiful canyon in Yellowstone! We were totally shocked while we took in it's beauty! It is so colorful..This is a must see in Yellowstone..

Words and pictures can't quite put the beauty of the falls into perspective. We went early to beat the September crowds and we were able to to get some really nice photos. The later you way to sightsee the more crowds you will have to wade through. Parking can be difficult, but it's worth the effort to witness the stunning views.
Area is pretty enough but hardly compares to the real thing. Definitely expected much more spectacular scenery than we saw.

We drove there from Mammoth to get there by 7.30am to beat the tourist busses, we just about made it to the South side ahead of the hoarders, note it is worth taking the path along the through the woods to see the canyon in the early morning light.
North side was good and we walking down to the brink of the lower falls, it's worth the walk.
Then get out out you have seen it all and the tour busses will have caught up with you.
Good luck

This had a lower and upper falls. The lower was from a distance but absolutely breathtaking views. So many people trying to get pictures with the falls behind them. The upper falls was close up and personal! Loved it!
Beautiful [place to visit....do the walk down to the falls, but remember, you still have to walk back up that hill....but worth it...

While not as overwhelming in size as Arizona's Grand Canyon, this is beautiful. The South Rim offers views that are much more readily accessible and, IMHO, far more striking. The North Rim views are limited unless you're willing and able to hike moderate distances (and inclines) which, for older folks, can be a challenge. Between the wildfire smoke and the altitude, the hiking part proved a bit too much for us. The South Rim was much easier and offered a couple of overlooks that provided incredible views.

Mother nature is amazing at the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. I recommend to start on the south rim for a spectacular view of the lower falls and the canyon walls. Then make your way to the north rim. We took so many pictures at both rims. It is so picturesque.

Stopped by the roadside to view this canyon. It is huge and I think deeper than some parts of Grand Canyon. No disabled parking spots available so it made it hard for my wife to get out of the car due to the narrowness of the parking bays.
Unexpected and beautiful! Nice paved trail. The rock formation colors are great. The waterfall is stunning.
I had no idea that this was part of Yellowstone. The scenery is gorgeous. We took a hike with a ranger on the South Rim, and learned a lot about the geological history of the park.

This is some of God's best work! The views of the canyon with all the different colored stone and the waterfall is stunning. Do not go to Yellowstone Park without stopping by here at Artistic Point. My words cannot do it justice, but I can promise you that you will not be disappointed!

places_url_reviews_title: Must See for ANYONE Going to Yellowstone
places_url_reviews_comment: The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is a Must See for ANYONE Going to Yellowstone. Upper and Lower Falls viewing areas are easily accessed from north and south rim viewing areas. Artist Point on south Rim is also a must see.

places_url_reviews_title: Great colors in the canyon and the falls are a must see
places_url_reviews_comment:
We visited the canyon on 9/2/17. We started at Artists Point on the south side. I'd recommend getting there early (8 am or so) because the light is great for photos and the crowds are not there yet. When we visited, the rest of the So. Rim Drive stops (Uncle Tom's, So. Rim trail) were closed for renovation which I believe will continue into 2018) so check with the park website on their status if they are important to your visit.
We then drove to the North Rim. We did the four outlook hikes:
The Lower Falls hike is worth doing and while there are a few switch backs it is not overly strenuous
Look outpoint is an easy walk to the edge of the canyon with great views of the falls.
The Red Rock hike is strenuous, with lots of stairs and switch backs but the view and photos you can get of the falls are worth the work. I highly recommend this hike.
the Grand view trail is a short easy walk to the edge, again great views of the canyon
As of Sept 2017, the Inspiration Point Rd and trail were closed for renovations. Check with the park website on when it will reopen in 2018.
Note: most but not all of the restrooms are pit toilets, if that is an issue Brink of the Lower Falls overlook has regular restrooms
Be sure and see the canyon while you are in Yellowstone.

places_url_reviews_title: The most beautiful views in the park
places_url_reviews_comment: After visiting the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone, it is clear why it's called Yellowstone. The views are stunning. You can take an extensive hike or drive around the rims and take modest hikes at each look out point.
Some people might say this is not as good as the Grand Canyon but to us this is just as grand. The view with the water falls just a must see. If you are in the park you have to go see it.

The colors of the deep canyon and river, coupled with the two large waterfalls are other worldly.
And, not as crowded as the Old Faithful area.
Highly recommend.
Although some of the points and hikes are shut down now - check before you go - we enjoyed what we could see. Amazing views.
Because of road construction, Inspiration Point was closed, and part of the south rim road was closed. We were able to walk to both falls and to Artist's Point, though.
This is a spectacular canyon to view at serveral locations north of Canon Village or between the famous falls. A must see in Yellowstone.
I have been to the Grand Canyon, now this. What a beautiful sight to behold. Years of flow created this beautiful canyon, do not be afraid to get close and look down, do it!
Beautiful 20 mike canyon with the upper and lower falls. Breath taking views everywhere. Tough to beat the part of the park.

places_url_reviews_title: Great hike to and along the Yellowstone river
places_url_reviews_comment: We loved this not to difficult hike for it's beautiful scenery. A must do when in Yellowstone. One can also get to scenic point without hiking too long and be able to see gorgeous sights of the river on both sides of the scenic vista and waterfalls at one end.

Beautiful site from above another must to see
Give yourself plenty of time traffic is crazy. You don't want to miss anything

Canyon was so deep and beautiful with yellow stone. We saw it from artist point. A must visit place in yellowstone national park. Morning time is good time I guess for artist point visit, will get good photos. After noon sun will be in front of us from artist point may not get good photos. From brink of lower falls afternoon should be good.

This breathtaking site is s wonderful place to take pictures and to hike. Don't miss the strenuous hike to the bottom if health allows. There are spots to rest along the way but it is taxing and, if you are able, worth it.

There are no words for how beautiful this place is! We could have watched the waterfall and soaked in the scenery all day. It's a hard walk down and back up, but shaded and doable with plenty of benches at every turn for those who need to sit for a spell. The hill going back up is winding but worth every pound lost

A few of the parking lots and trails were closed for construction, but that didn't affect our trip. Artist Point was busy in the car park, but not too bad, and definitely well worth the visit - stunning view of the lower falls and valley. We did most of the trails on the other side, and although the hills back up from the falls edge were steep, it was worth the walk.
The painted canyon wall is worth the short hike and the waterfall is impressive. It was worth the short hike to go see this attraction.

I am NOT one for heights - I had never been to YNP as a kid, so was a little stunned & got the nasty surprise of sheer drop-offs and gorges. We came to this one and I found it scary as the passenger. My husband enjoyed the views. :0

This was the second time we went there. The first time, there were so many people around. You were barely able to take a picture or have a clear view of what was downtown there. The second, maybe because we arrived in the late afternoon, only a few people were there. We could take a better look at the canyon. I will say a must go place, especially with the sunset sunshine.

places_url_reviews_title: Absolutely stunning. A real treat to see this place.
places_url_reviews_comment:
We were blown away with this visit. I just wish that we had more time to do some of the treks . I must have taken several dozen photographs of this location.
A highly recommended visit. You will not be disappointed 👍🇺🇸
This place is a must see. The falls and the power of the river carving through the rocks will take your breath away. Come early in the morning or later in the evening to avoid the crowds.

After Old Faithful, this place probably ranks number #2 on the list. Strangely I haven't heard of this canyon prior to visiting Yellowstone but with the combination of a beautiful talls falls (twice the height of Niagara Falls), pine forest, and canyon, this is one of the most beautiful places I've ever seen and it was entirely created by nature and preserved by the national park service.
There is a north rim and south rim. The road goes fairly close to multiple sites on both rims. You can hike around both rims (short distance). You can't hike down to the canyon. If you want to see the river, go upstream to the Yellowstone lake or downstream to the hike by Tower Falls or much later driving north out of Yellowstone on highway 89.

Between the colors of the canyon and perfect view of the falls this place catches your breath. We only saw the canyon and falls from one of the viewing points and cant wait to plan our next trip to do more hiking down into the canyons. This is a must do at YNP but takes at least a day to do right unless you are like us and just stop for a quick photo.

This is something that I had missed during my last visit to Yellowstone and we were glad to take the time to see it during this visit. There is a trail along the rim that you can hike, take that in the direction away from the falls to avoid the larger crowds.
Terrific views of waterfalls. No need to take long walks down the paths. The canyon is nice but the real attraction is the waterfalls.

This is a must see! Some of the trails were closed but the falls were still accessible for viewing. There are several trails that take you closer to lower falls (like Red Rock). Short but steep. From artists point on the south rim, I highly recommend the Ribbon Lake trail. About .5 miles along the canyon rim. Not for the faint of heart but views of the canyon are amazing.
A must stop if you visit Yellowstone NP. Artist point is one of our favorite spot in the park. Too bad the north rim trail was closed in places for fixing.
Not quite as fabulous as the Grand Canyon of Arizona but still nice. There may have been some hiking trails but we did not have the time or energy to explore.
The vistas are beautiful. The vistas provided to stop and look can get crowded. Going early morning is more enjoyable with the less crowded.

I highly recommend the ranger talk for this. They make what is already a beautiful experience even more fun. Remember, if you are deaf you can order a sign interpreter 3 weeks in advance. Wear comfortable shoes and bring the best camera you can afford. I can see why early explorers were so amazed with this location.
Wow, what a view. No trip to Yellowstone would be complete without a trip to Artist Point. I hope I someday can return

places_url_reviews_title: Wonder no more why it is called Yellowstone
places_url_reviews_comment: If you ever wondered why it is called the Yellowstone, visit to this canyon will answer that question. Not obvious in other parts for Yellowstone, NP, the yellow (and other color rocks) carved out and exposed by the Yellowstone river falls are quite a sight. Be sure to visit the Artist Point on the East side, as well as all the vista points on the west at Upper and Lower Falls. View will of course vary as the day progresses. Mornings are likely to be clear with clouds (and thunderstorms) rolling in later in the day.
Must see . Little busy but just needed to wait a short minute to get a better view . Bit view is unbelievable. Must see

The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone can be described in many ways.
I would simply recommend you go see it yourself.
Truly unmissable!

Real close. Absolutely Beautiful! More for me too say, no, except TripAdvisor wants me to.
Just go and see. No one in Yellowstone can't miss this.

places_url_reviews_title: The Grand Canyon of the West
places_url_reviews_comment: You must include this on your stops! This is a fantastic sight to see and experience. Plenty of spots for great pictures.

A big surprise for us to realize how spectacular Canyon was within the Park. The trails are well marked and in some areas surprising close to the canyon rim. There are guided tours along the trails. The Canyon is surprisingly deep, steep and narrow. This is also a very popular area and parking can be horrific. Plan for an early morning visit to get ahead of the crowds.

places_url_reviews_title: Quite the hike back to the top, but the view is worth it
places_url_reviews_comment: Absolutely gorgeous views no matter where you hike from, as there are two different paths to take down the canyon.
Another beautiful part of the park. There are a few spots that you can stop to view the valley, waterfall and river

A don't miss, must see attraction. Best to view from several different surrounding vantage points to get the full impact. Suggest going in the morning rather than afternoon for best photos due to shadows late in the day.

Yellowstone National Park
Before a visit you really have to do some research. The ideal is to stay in the park, which takes a year of lead time or guts and luck. We are always impressed at the quality and service provided by the NPS. Our nation does some things well.
I think it's important to plan the spots you really want to see. Plan on picnics and several hikes. Without planning you will spend too much time in a car. Our favorite was the canyon at the upper and lower falls. Truly amazing, it explains why the park is named Yellowstone.
With no reservations, we found cancellations at several of the prime resorts. That's the guts and luck part. If you find nothing, your forced to stay at one of the fringe towns outside the parks entrance. This option increases your drive time and many of the accommodations are also filled during the summer season. Not the easiest NP to enjoy but well worth the effort.
Musts do and get out and see all the overlooks. If physically able, you must to the brink of the falls hikes. Breathtaking!

This really is quite astonishing - a surprisingly deep canyon worthy of its name. There are several viewpoints and each one offers breath-taking views. Well worth the crush of other tourists and packed car parks - try and get there early!
Great views from Artist Point. Parking is a pain because too many drivers block the flow while waiting for another car to back out and leave.

places_url_reviews_title: A must see on your Yellowstone trip
places_url_reviews_comment: This was absolutely breathtaking!! We hiked down to the bottom to get a closer look at the waterfall - truly spectacular!
Absolutely beautiful. Visited early evening which led to great lighting for pictures. Busiest time for visiting is 10-4 so try to visit before or after
This part of the park is definitely worth seeing. Plenty to see right off the loop or hike a little to see more. Worth a stop

places_url_reviews_title: Must visit preferably in during sun set
places_url_reviews_comment: Awesome Artists Point South Rim Don't miss it. You will see why Yellow stone gets its name. The beautiful waterfall and the Yellowstone river cutting into the Canyon with Yellow Stones is a remarkable sight
We loved this. Really nice walkway around (took maybe 15 mins in total, including photo time). Stunning views.

places_url_reviews_title: Stunning drives along both rims of this incredible canyon
places_url_reviews_comment: The yellow stone of Yellowstone Canyon gives its name to the park, and for good reason. It is a breathtaking sight which can be enjoyed from a series of viewpoints (with ample parking) along both rims. The waterfall at the head of the canyon can be viewed from several locations along either rim, the best probably being Grand View. Artist Point, Lookout Point, Grand View and Upper Falls View are all well worth a visit to get a different perspective on this extraordinary canyon. When we visited the points on the north rim were significantly less busy than on the south, but this could just be a quirk of wherever the many coachloads of tourists happened to be at the time!
The view of this massive canyon from above is gorgeous. Loads of rock formations, the forest that runs right up to the rim, all combine for an inspirational view.
If visiting Yellowstone, viewing the Grand Canyon is an absolute must. Uncle Tom's Trail was closed when we visited, but was highly recommended by family friends.
Watching the river cascade over the falls into the canyon is amazing. But more so because of the sparkling colors of the canyon. What a site!!! Go see it.
One of the most amazing sites anywhere. We took an easy walk to artists point for this view. Not too crowded on a busy day. Go about 9:45 am and you might see a rainbow over the falls.

places_url_reviews_title: Traveling with a Toddler and Infant
places_url_reviews_comment: As we had a toddler we knew we couldn't hike the canyon area and knew the viewpoints had steep drop offs. But there was a turnout with a stone wall that was appropriate for stopping with much better views than the main viewing area.

places_url_reviews_title: South Rim Drive and North Rim Drive
places_url_reviews_comment: Great views. We especially enjoyed Artist Point which had a nice view of the falls. South Rim drive was nicer than north.
There are several views . I loved the view at artist point . I had my parents with me and they could not walk to far so this one was perfect for them plus It was an amazing site
A photograpphers delight and offers far more to see than some of the much more publicised areas. Many of the sights along the way are very easy to reach

Starting at the Wapiti picnic area we hiked easy trails that brought us through mountain meadows, and to a view of the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. Hiking made it more special. The walk was 7 miles, but essentially was flat, and easy walking.
The Falls are breathtaking, and totally worth the hike.
You can also get there by car, but walking there through the natural scenery was worth the trip!
This whole area is just beautiful and worth seeing! This was an excellent highlight for this trip. It is a must see area.

Summer 2017,with all the renovation work being done to the roads and parking areas around the Canyon, it can be frustrating to get near the rim and the open viewpoints. But don't skip them! They're among the most beautiful, inspiring sites in the park. Get there early- like 7:00 a.m. early- to have your pick of parking spots, photo ops and trails. Morning 'Must See's' open now on the South Rim: 1) entire Artist's Point viewing area, all 3 levels offer different views 2) a walk of any length on the trail to Point Sublime (many points along this path that we label 'Point Good Enough' if not enough time to do the entire trail!) Afternoon/Evening Must See's open on the North Rim are: 1) Upper Falls Overlook and 2) Inspiration Point. If you go when everything is open again, visit everything on the map on both rims- you won't regret it. Spend the night, go to the North Rim during afternoon/evening and do the South Rim in the morning for the best light for photos. Opinions vary on this, but we've been coming here since the 70's & our pictures tell the story.
We used Yellowstone Alpine Guides for an all day guided tour of the lower loop which included this site. They were great as was the site!

Yellowstone is full of natural wonders, but the Grand Canyon is at the top. There are different points to view it from, but Artist Point is an absolute must if you want to get the shot on all the postcards. Get there early, like before 9am, if you want to make it easy to find a parking space. Also, it put's the morning light on the falls for a better picture. There's a chance of a rainbow, too, around 9:30-10am, over the falls. There are basically 3 drives with stops you need to make to see the canyon area, all very close to each other. One is South Rim Drive, which includes Uncle Tom's Trail (currently closed for repairs) and Artist Point. The next is Brink of the Upper Falls. The third is North Rim Drive, which includes Lookout Point, Grand View, and Inspiration Point (also currently closed). All the drives come off of the Grand Loop Road, and are basically just 5-10 minutes away from the Canyon Village area where there is dining, a general store, and a visitor center.

If you go no where else you must go to Artists Point - it is spectacular! You can see the falls, a great view of the falls deep down in the canyon, the beautiful colors of the rock and many Opsrey nests if you have binoculars. And Please take binoculars so you can experience the full effect. And go early in the day if you want to avoid the summer crowds.
We got there in the evening and there was plenty of parking. We chose not to do the hikes. We did get out and look at a lot of the over looks. Worth the drive. Got some great shots.

Living in Arizona, I was rather offended to having anything else classified as a "Grand Canyon" since we have the "real" one! Wow, was I surprised and humbled! This area of Yellowstone definitely deserves to be called "Grand." While very different from the "other" Grand Canyon, it is equally spectacular in its own right.
Go early; it gets very crowded at the pull offs later in the day. Walk around and experience the beauty and majesty from various vantage points and various trails. It is one of the most impressive sites in Yellowstone. Take it from an original Grand Canyon snob, you'll be delighted you spent time at this beautiful site!

places_url_reviews_title: Don't miss this attraction at Yellowstone National Park
places_url_reviews_comment:
The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is a MAJOR highlight of any trip to this National Park. It is not visited as much as Old Faithful but it is easily as spectacular to behold!!!
Take the short walk from beginning to end but DO NOT take any photos until you start to trek back to the beginning of the trail. It just gets prettier as you move along. Do not miss this lovely attraction. It only takes a short time but there is MUCH to take in along the way!!!!
This was one of the highlights of Yellowstone. This area is very busy with limited parking. Plan on doing some walking to get good views. The best views are from the lower viewing areas.

This was one of the "wow" moments in YSP. It was raining hard that day so we could not stay very long. From the parking lot, you can take a short walk to the viewpoints along there and check out the beautiful views. Must see!

We headed to the south rim drive, since the view was supposed to better, but uncle Tom's trail (The classic view) was closed for renovation. We drove to end, artist's point, that was an easy stroll from the parking lot, and the view was definitely worth it!

We had the opportunity to visit Yellowstone National Park and found it a wonderful place to visit. We did the whole tour and all were amazed at Mother Nature at work. Great visit, recommend it to all.

The beauty of this pace takes your breath away. I consider this a "must stop" point. You can park at several different places along the way as you get to see and appreciate the magnificence of the canyon. In peak hours day during summer time it can be challenging to find a spot as parking is limited but if you are patient you always find one. The stop is not long (stop, go take a look, take pictures.. admire the place.. then off to the next) so there is always someone leaving every few minutes. We personally found that the best times are before 10 am and after 4 pm, and you also get the benefit of not catching the heat as much either if you come early (and is summer time). You can (of course) drive there at any time but expect crowds between 10 am & 4 pm so patience is key. Remember to park in designated areas as Park Rangers and Patrols are always around.
Parking was limited in lots due to crowds and some trails under renovation but the beauty surpassed the crowds. Definitely go to all areas.

places_url_reviews_title: Amazing, Amazing, Amazing - like a postcard
places_url_reviews_comment: We were awestruck by the beauty of this area. We saw both sides of the canyon and would advise visitors to do the same. We would have loved to have hiked along the canyon, but all the trails were closed. There is parking on both sides, although the eastern side is more crowded, with less parking. Be patient and parking spaces will open up. Viewing the canyon does not take that long on that side. Some of our pictures look like postcards, like it is not real. Just amazing.

Yellowstone National Park has much to offer and one of the must see places is the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. It's a highly visited place so expect traffic and perhaps a search for a parking place. Park police patrol the area so be careful where you park! It's a short walk from the parking lot to the Canyon and well worth the time. There are excellent views of the falls and the canyon from the South side of the loop. We did not do the north loop of spend anytime at the Canyon Village. A must see.

This was one of the neatest things to see in the park. we loved it and the waterfall was amazing. Easy hiking around it. make sure you check out both the lower and upper part of the canyon to get the entire view. well worth every minute it takes to get there. (go early, no one in yellowstone does anything until 9 a.m. so if you get to anything early there is no traffic)

Incredible canyon with amazing colors and multiple viewing locations.
The hike down is well worth the view of the waterfall and down the canyon.
Like lots of the Yellowstone highlights, this is packed. Not enough parking and lots of people unaware of those around them. That said, it's an absolutely gorgeous view and worth the chaos.
Our last stop at Yellowstone and what a Grand Vista! We hiked down to the top of the waterfall and it was well worth it!! A must see area that shouldn't be past up!!!

places_url_reviews_title: Grand Canyon of Yellowstone OK but no comparison to the real Grand Canyon
places_url_reviews_comment: Steep Cliffs and a higher background of pine trees. You could see the river down at the bottom flowing through. Nice view but not quite likely Grand Canyon in Arizona.
A little crowded, but that is to be expected with the view. Great picture taking place. Would love to paint it.
So different from what you expect in Yellowstone, this is a double waterfall that cuts through the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone river. Saw a badger as an extra bonus!

No photo can capture the intensity of the depth, the color, the vastness of this beautiful place. Go early or you'll have crowds to contend with- parking is limited. Bring your camera and spend some time soaking it all in.

places_url_reviews_title: Second only to the Grand Canyon
places_url_reviews_comment: Worth the trip just to see this. You really must see every part of the North Rim (extremely crowded), Brink of the Falls (literally hanging on the edge of the Falls) and South Rim, all within a couple of miles. If you can make it, take one of the trails down into the Canyon (very steep and narrow and probably a 700' drop - think 40+ stories.) You may wait 15 or more minutes for a parking space on the North Rim Loop. Spaces open up further along, but everyone just waits for one in the first lot! Walk the rim trail - if it gets too steep, walk along the road for that part. FYI: Inspiration Point is closed indefinitely - looks like it was falling into the Canyon! Uncle Toms is also closed for a major renovation so a spectacular set of stairs into the Canyon is closed..

We saw Yellowstone as a part of a Backroads tour group. Yellowstone is overrun by so many tourists and majority of them are not American. I do not care for crowds! The best part of Yellowstone is the Canyon where there is less people. We hiked along the cliff side of the Canyon and it was beautiful. If I had to choose between the Tetons and Yellowstone, I would definitely choose the Tetons... the other 4 families traveling with this tour agreed.
Parking difficult. Good views but paths a bit tricky. Quite crowded.Signage wasn't the best as how to go

If you're in Yellowstone and you don't see this then you will surely have missed out. Just do it!
Artists point is s great vantage point.

places_url_reviews_title: What a view & an incredible hike!!!
places_url_reviews_comment: Hiked the south rim ( uncle toms path was closed) but walked around the rim. Breathtaking views!! Take the time for this hike it will not disappoint!! I promise😍
Just amazing views and beauty. Must stop. Many overlooks and just breath taking views. Go early in the morning to avoid the crowds and tour buses.

places_url_reviews_title: A must see but be aware of altitude if you hike down!!
places_url_reviews_comment: We hiked to the lowest level (Inspiration Point is closed for repairs until 2018) and really loved seeing the force and power of the falls so close!!! The rainbow is always there and usually a double one. Great camera shots. Just remember you have to climb back up to get to the parking area. Make sure you take water and hydrate both ways. The hike is switch backs but still difficult for anyone who is not use to hiking or who has mobility issues.

Truly is Grand Canyon of Yellowstone but more in tune with Bryce Canyon. Artist's Point was gorgeous and if you have the energy and time then follow some of the trails. It's best to get there as early as possible and make sure you stop at the beautiful Lower Falls.
The long walk down was great! My phone registered a 48 story drop. The top of the falls was a highlight in the Park!
The best place to view this canyon is Artist's Point. Beautiful view of the canyon and Lower Falls. A must see!

places_url_reviews_title: I liked this better than the Grand Canyon
places_url_reviews_comment: Take a photo with the falls and canyon behind you and it will be your best photo of your entire vacation. Get there early or you will wait to even get into the lot to search for a parking spot. Well worth any effort you need to put into it, though.

places_url_reviews_title: Awesome views (and visit the big Grand Canyon too :-)=
places_url_reviews_comment:
This a truly a wonderful spot to go to when in Yellowstone. Parking can be iffy if you don't get there early.
If this is your first visit, perhaps consider spending a few dollars and take the Yellowstone in a Day tour and let the tour driver worry about parking, plus they will tell you sooo much more about the park.
This remains the best attraction in Yellowstone. Breathtaking views of the water falls and an incredible canyon. Lots of places to take pictures and enjoy this natural wonder.

Do not miss. At the rim you can see the river and the upper falls, which are beautiful. Don't pass up the hike to the river level and the crest of the lower falls, which also gives you an extraordinary view of the canyon. It is a steep and fairly strenuous hike down and back-take your time, it is definitely worth it.
Then on the way out, stop at the lookout where you can see the entire lower falls, it also provides you with another beautiful view of the canyon.
I never knew this place existed! Really beautiful but supervise young children. We had the pleasure of viewing the osprey best with two young chicks. Quite cool.

There are 2 water falls you can see from the trail. They are magnificent. So is the canyon. One of the trail goes to the bottom of the canyon in front of lower falls. But it is quite an exercise to climb up back to the parking lot.
I took over 300 pictures in this area. The colors and water are breathtaking. I was amazed at falls and split my time between taking photo after photo and just taking it in.

We had only half a day in Yellowstone, and the two can't-miss spots were Old Faithful and the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. Traffic might be heavy especially if there is wildlife on the roads (We were in a bison-related traffic jam for about 45 minutes), but take the drive around the loop from Old Faithful to the Canyon - you won't regret it! There are many areas you can stop, park, and get out for different angles of the falls. There are walking paths that take you even closer although we didn't have time to go on them. No matter what you do in Yellowstone, make sure the Grand Canyon is part of it!

places_url_reviews_title: One of the best National Parks in the U.S.A.!
places_url_reviews_comment:
Awesome park with much natural wonders to see e.g. geysers, hot pots, colored fields etc. Be sure to take a few hikes as well as bears, elks, buffalo and osprey can be spotted quite easily. I can see why this park was the first to be denominated as a National Park!
Definitely spend a few days here!
Worth the effort to view falls from Red Rock trail and platform. Take water, wear good walking or hiking shoes/boots. Kids may need extra time to rest during the walk.
The North Rim and South Rim of the Yellowstone Grand Canyon are worth it for a stop. Breathtaking scenery!

The canyon is full of beautiful color and huge rock formations! The waterfall is magnificent. Along the ride there are signs showing how old the rock formations are, some as old as 400,000,000 million years. So hard to comprehend. It is an amazing site to behold!
This is a must see. Both Falls and the Grand Canyon had to be one of the most gorgeous sights in Yellowstone.
We lucked out and were there in late afternoon. It was still busy but we easily found a parking spot. Only sorry Inspirational Point was closed.

Not as grand as "the Grand Canyon" of the Colorado River, but still a very impressive site.
Read about the geology of its formation given on the display boards, particularly about the bank that are lined at the top with a "rock fence".

Come see the majestic Bison in Lamar Valley! We visited during rut, so saw lots of running and action. Be prepared for Bison crossing the road or for slowed traffic - it is their park! It is truly amazing to see these animals so close!
It is busy and parking means waiting, but the view is beautiful. Lots of tourists and people trying to get into a small space.

This was my favorite spot in the Yellowstone Park for the stunning scenery and it was a real "Wow" moment, beautiful & I got some amazing photos- make sure you stop here, there is good parking but at the busy season it can be tricky to get one.

The subtle colors yet the majestic background is so beautiful. I've been to the Grand Canyon in Arizona and it is mind blowing, this is totally different yet it's still worth a visit. The waterfall is fantastic and it's very easy to get a top notch view. This is a must see in Yellowstone.
Its one of the best views of Yellowstone! We went in the first week of August, it wasn't that crowded. The view is simply mesmerizing. Do not miss this one if you are traveling to Yellowstone!

The Grand Canyon and the lower falls are just breathtaking. Great spots from as well the north as the south rim. A walk down to the roaring water is absolutely a must.
Just be carefull in summertime: a long line of cars might be ahead of you (like yesterday) to park at the only parking lot. I turned around, way too crowded.
Early spring and September, October are way calmer and the light is still gorgeous.
A must when visiting the park!

It was POURING when we arrived, but my husband braved the weather to go see it. He said he couldn't even describe it. I wished I would have gotten out of the car to take a look, now I only get to see what he saw in a picture.

Correctly the top rated place in Yellowstone, with beautiful views and an ever changing scenery. While "the" Grand Canyon is spectacular and awesome based on size and scale, the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone seems more personal and beautiful. Do not miss its wonderful falls and so many different views.
Plan on spending some time at this stop. It's absolutely beautiful! Great place for a photo or two and you will see wildlife all around the roads leading to this area of the park!

Driving the great loop road requires patience. It is common to have long delays for animals wandering on the highway or road work. The pullouts for attractions are always full and crowded, parking can be a challenge, especially for large vehicles pulling travel trailers and motor homes. The traffic in the park is starting to overwhelm the parks ability to accommodate it. Some of the heavily traveled trails around the attractions are in disrepair. Yellowstone is where cultures collide. Be ready to encounter bus loads of foreign visitors that don't have time to respect your space, their goal is to quickly get their pictures and get back to the bus. So sit back and relax put your favorite music on the IPOD. It's all part of the experience.

The Grand Canyon is one of the prettiest places in the park. It's a very short walk to the vista area although there are three sets of stairs on the path. Not good for baby strollers but for even a poor hiker, it's an easy walk.
The Canyon is not the size or colors of the real one but it's majestic and a real treasure. Absolutely worth a stop. Great picture taking sight.

We took the north rim scenic drive and stopped at Lookout Point. It had good parking and was a short walk to the observation spot. We heard the falls before we saw them, and they were amazing! What a view!

Simply the most scenic area of Yellowstone. Having been here before about 40 years ago, it still takes your breath away! Pictures can't do it justice as it looks like a painting. Multiple short hikes around the canyon area, but still very good views from the lookouts. Along with the animal viewing, best part of Yellowstone!

No it's not as breathtaking as the 'real' Grand Canyon, but it is beautiful with very amazing views. As with all 'stops' in the Park, it can be crowded in the parking area, but so worth the stop. Enjoy the waterfalls.

places_url_reviews_title: Amazing views of the canyon and waterfalls
places_url_reviews_comment: There are several opportunities for viewing the canyon but the best, and hardest to get to, is the brink of the lower falls. This walk is a 600 foot drop in elevation with many switchbacks on pavement that is sandy and broken up. We braved the walk and were so happy we did. Standing on the brink of the falls and looking out at the canyon as the river winds through the canyon walls is amazing. This is not a walk for anyone that has trouble going up and down hills without side rails. Wear sneakers or hiking shoes, not sandals! There are other spots that are easier to access along the rim but the best is the lower falls.

This is a nice, quiet stop along the winding roads of Yellowstone. There is a boardwalk along the ridge and one you can walk down to get closer into the canyon. All you hear are the birds chirping and the riveting rushing. Very beautiful stop!

places_url_reviews_title: A Quick Must Stop - Get Here Early
places_url_reviews_comment: The view here is beautiful. The massive canyon, huge waterfall at the end and colors of the rock here just have to be seen in person. My husband and I arrived somewhat early (7-8 am) and it was already starting to get pretty busy and I think this is a pretty popular spot so if you really want to spend a lot of time here and get it to yourself you'd need to go early. It does have a pretty big parking lot and a two leveled lookout platform. In my opinion, this is a quick stop but a must stop! You won't be sorry for battling the crowds even.

places_url_reviews_title: if you are pressed for time, choose something else
places_url_reviews_comment: This canyon isn't even pretty, but then again I have seen the Real Grand Canyon. It is near a upper and lower waterfalls if you wish to stop and see them. But if you are pressed for time, I would skip the canyons. Plus during tourist season it is SUPER crowded.
This area was one of the most beautiful areas I thought in Yellowstone. The view was incredible. Would highly recommend a stop here.

You will see an amazing cross-section of the geology of Yellowstone. It's not as large as its cousin to the south, but is just as spectacular.
Its much less crowded than other attractions at Yellowstone, but shouldn't be missed.
If you want to take a little hike, there is a nice trail from near the Canyon Lodge that leads to the lookout for the canyon.

places_url_reviews_title: Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is Absolutely Beautiful
places_url_reviews_comment: Make sure you check out the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone National Park while you are there. It is very accessible, you can drive either the North or South rim road. It is very easy to pull off and walk back a little bit and take some pictures. We visited both rims. You get different views of the waterfalls from each rim. Our favorite was "Artist's Point" at the South Rim. There is a fabulous view of the waterfall from there. We had a perfect day with beautiful blue skies above which contrasted just right with the earthy tones of the canyon. Just stunning.

Even though a good part of the south rim was closed, we were able to get a good view of the fall from the south rim. We had intended to hike, but the route we initially chose was closed. The ranger was able to give us a great alternative to hike from Artist's Point to Point Sublime. The hike was about 7 mi rd trip. There were lots of great views of the Canyon along the way, though we were a bit disappointed of the view from Point Sublime. There were definitely better views on the hike up than from Point Sublime.
Gorgeous views, 8 am the buses, campers, dangerous drivers and vandals are up yet and you get a truly enjoyable experience if one of a kind creation.

places_url_reviews_title: Expansive Views that Make You Feel Small
places_url_reviews_comment:
Stop here. Take a moment to realize the sheer beauty in the landscape that surrounds you. Listen to the water moving. Take it all in.
Tips:
- parking can be tricky once the crowds start pouring in. We found the parking lots to be the easiest to maneuver before 10:30am.
- walk along the various paths to get different perspectives of Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone
- leave the selfie sticks in the car... they're annoying!

places_url_reviews_title: Gorgeous- one of the more majestic things at Yellowstone
places_url_reviews_comment: Yellowstone is amazing for the geologic formations,etc. But, it's not really very majestic. This is the one exception- breathtaking scenery. Make sure you go EARLY to avoid the immense crowds, and view it from several different angles.
Great landscape. The colours, the water, the nature are extraordinary. It's a place to visit and enjoy it

I didn't know this place existed! We stopped with our tour group and a short walk up some steps and I was amazed at the view! You can view the falls from the side if you can't make it up the steps- but if you can- awesome view! I believe bathrooms are available if needed.

I haven't been to THE Grand Canyon, so for now this will be my wow experience. Truly, though, it's the Lower Falls that steals the show. What a spectacle! The size and power of this waterfall is just amazing. We hiked Uncle Tom's Trail, starting at Artist Point due to the closure of the closer parking lot. This created a traffic situation, but all was forgiven once we parked and began to get glimpses of this canyon.

places_url_reviews_title: Must do the Brink and Uncle Tom's Trail while there
places_url_reviews_comment: Yeah, it's nice to get a glimpse of the falls and canyon, but if you're physically able, you absolutely must do The Brink and Uncle Tom's Trail. Those are both Bucket List experiences. You don't have to be an athlete;just take it easy and you can do both in just a few hours.

Just completely blown away by the views of the canyon and falls. We did the hike down to the falls overlook - we just sat and stared down the canyon, seeing the ribbon of the river while the falls poured over next to us.
The hike down was fairly steep but lots of switchbacks - so everyone can basically do it.
We visited twice - early morning and late evening. On the second occasion we saw an osprey nest with chicks. Superb!

Every visitor to Yellowstone should visit the Canyon. The overlooks are often full of tourists (go early or late). But, the lookouts are wonderful. If you have a chance, walk between a few of the lookouts or even just several hundred yards before or after the lookouts. You'll probably find yourself almost by yourself. They are constantly working on roads and trails, it is a very real possibility that some of this area will be closed.

places_url_reviews_title: Our FAVORITE in all of Yellowstone
places_url_reviews_comment: Worth every stop and every overlook, especially beautiful in the evening when the yellow stone is so yellow!
It was so beautiful to see the different colors of rock and sand with the falls. Parking was really hard and a wait but it is really worth it to see God's beauty!
We hiked to the upper and lower falls. We even saw a longhorn sheep. The is a steep walk down on uneven paths, but well worth the effort. The kids are 10 and 11 and did great.

By far the most awe inspiring sight for us in Yellowstone. The trails to the upper and lower falls are not for the faint hearted but totally worth it! Such beauty and magnificence! Come early! The crowds get a little crazy as the day progresses.

places_url_reviews_title: Put this attraction on your plan punch list
places_url_reviews_comment:
The canyon view is a must see. Be prepared for Disney sized crowds. The viewing area is just a short ~100 meter walk from the parking lot which is crowded requiring us to ‘spin for a spot’ around the parking to a few times to secure an open parking spot. There is a walking trail that extends out of the main viewing area that is a leisurely walk with magnificent views. I figure less than 10% of overall visitors walk this trail so it’s a wonderful opportunity to see the sights away from the masses.
The views from both sides of the canyon are simply unforgettable!
Stopping at several viewpoints will give you the experience. We did not do the whole rim. Gods country!
My partner and I have both previously been to Yellowstone but had not visited the falls. It was wonderful! How have we missed it all the times before! The hike down is worth the views!

I've seen the Grand Canyon, but the colors of Yellowstone Grand Canyon are spectacular. The falls are beautiful. A must see. easy access I was on scooter, very busy this time of year, but patience is the game,
This is a must see in Yellowstone! The colors were amazing! It was almost as beautiful as the real Grand Canyon!

places_url_reviews_title: Whole area was great, get there really early
places_url_reviews_comment: Unfortunately the south rim was closed for construction, but we were able to pull off and see several points of interest anyway. The canyon was very cool, loved the multiple waterfalls. It was not too busy. We stayed in Cody and left at 5 am to get in the park. Did this for two days and tried to see the busy things before 12 and spent the afternoons in more quite areas. When we drove back past this at 2 in the afternoon, there was no way to even get in. Go Early!

The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is one of the most beautiful places in Yellowstone National Park and it is a sight not to be missed. The waterfalls are amazing and the colors of the canyon walls are unbelievable and beautiful. Artist Point is one of the best places to see the canyon and the falls and the lookout point is only a short walk from the parking lot. The area can get very crowded, but it is worth visiting.
Worth the view and the hikes that are open. The pounding of the water takes your breath away. Very large waterfall with gorgeous canyon scenery. Well worth a trip if you are in the area
I was told this was the reason to Yellowstone become a national park. No doubt it's worth. Put it in your wish list.
The lookout gives a bird’s eye view of the canyon. It was cool to see actual birds flying at our level and swooping into the canyon.

places_url_reviews_title: Pleasantly overwhelming vistas and plenty of exercise
places_url_reviews_comment:
Artists point and Sublime Point in the South Rim of the Canyon, Brink of Upper Falls, Brink of Lower Falls, Red Rock Point and Grand View in the North Rim all offer varying vantage points of the Canyon, the mighty Falls and the Yellowstone River. Except for the Artists Point, Brink of Upper Falls and Grand View, the rest requires a long and relatively challenging hikes, especially the Brink of Lower Falls; however, each one is a must see!
The Sublime Point, in my humble opinion is over rated. Reaching the end of the .5 mile rugged trail and seeing the view made me exclaim "That' it?". Along the trail from Artists to Sublime Point, there are several pleasantly overwhelming view angles of the canyon and Yellowstone River.
Despite the fact that Uncle Tom's Trail is under maintenance and, therefore, closed, our number of steps for the day exceeded 17,000. We hiked to the Red Rock Point on another day.
Food at the Canyon Village is good with healthy choices. The pulled park sandwich with salad is delicious.

places_url_reviews_title: Not the REAL Grand Canyon but lovely just the same!
places_url_reviews_comment: Highly recommend this hike from Artist Point to Inspiration Point. It's not the destination per se it's all along the way the view of the river and falls and nature! It wasn't too strenuous and actually gets you away from all the people at Artist Point. The parking lot is small there.

We did the Grand Canyon this year and this is still a sight to see! The falls, the canyon, Yellowstone river, all amazing. I'd recommend artist point for sure!! Then walk towards observation point if only for a little over to get a few more points of view of it all!!
All view are incredible but the South loop was great. Also be sure to do the hikes to the waterfall lookouts.

This place is a must see along with old faithful. The views of the falls are amazing. The first turnoff is for the basin view. It is a bit of hike if you have difficulty walking. We prefer to go up to the second area where you can get a look at the falls from the top. Seems like most folks try to get into the first area perhaps without knowing about what's ahead so there were fewer people at the top lookout. We were disappointed that inspiration point was closed. It has some amazing views as well. We visited here 25 years ago on our honeymoon - it was definitely worth coming back to see.

places_url_reviews_title: It is a mini-me of the Grand Canyon.
places_url_reviews_comment: It is not the Grand Canyon, but it is awesome and beautiful with its water falls, colorful carved rock sides, and the river flowing through the bottom. Don't miss it.
Gorgeous, gorgeous, gorgeous! Absolutely beautiful. Would highly recommend. Not much trekking to waterfalls.

The hike to Point Sublime will give you the most beautiful view of the Yellowstone Canyon! It is beyond words. The hike to Point Sublime in a nice hike, but the distance on the sign is incorrect, but it is not a hard hike and the views of the gorge are so worth it.
A piece of advice - Don't forget bug spray, the mosquitos are pretty bad. I do NOT reccomend that you hike to Ribbon Lake!! You will be swarmed by mosquitos (they are not so bad to Point Sublime.) The hike to Ribbon Lake is not really even pretty, through the swamp, pretty much all flat.
This is a must see in Yellowstone. The closer parking lot was closed when we went but still got a beautiful fun with lots of nice pictures. Easy walk There are a few stairs.
Though it doesn't compare to the real Grand Canyon it is still beautiful and awesome. Parking at the north and south rims is terrible. Go before 8am or after 6pm.

I don't care how good a photographer you are, you can't describe this in any way other than "go see it for yourself". We stopped at upper falls and Artist's Point only, during the day, but the views are already breathtaking. One might die of suffocation if coming at sunrise or sunset. Prepare to be amazed.

This has to be the most beautiful part of Yellowstone. Once you get to the brink of lower fall, take the little hike - 3/8 of mile - down to the edge of the river. What awaits you is the amazing view of yellowstone canyon and its waterfall. Bring water for the hike up back to the parking lot. Don't miss it!

Get here early in order to avoid long lines. The views are spectacular here and very worth the visit! We stopped on the north side of the canyon and viewed from the parking lot. We did not have to take any long hikes. Many great photo ops!!!
Easy drive around the loop road. Easy pathways to walk around, you don't have to do the strenuous walks down to some viewpoints to get an amazing view. A MUST SEE for everyone as it is amazing!
Must see. Can't fully describe or capture on picture, even on pano. Just can't miss it if you are there.

This was one of our favorite stops in Yellowstone! It's beautiful to see the gorgeous blue water rushing through the amazingly colorful rock walls around it. It's also a nice and easy walk to the overlook from the parking spot (once we finally got a spot, ha!) and pretty well shaded.

The Artist lookout and the beautiful upper falls and lower falls lookouts are the perfect way to spend a day at Yellowstone. You won't believe all you can see. There were parts easy enough for the very elderly and small children and parts more and more challenging. This canyon and its falls are grand on so many levels. Take binoculars for bird spotting. The power of these falls is just magnetic. The lookouts are varied and fun. You can ask for specific details from rangers in Canyon Village at the museum and visitor center.

places_url_reviews_title: One of our Great National Parks here in the U.S.
places_url_reviews_comment: This park is connected to the Yellowstone National Park, which makes it nice to see two parks basically in one.

places_url_reviews_title: Not for the faint of heart.
places_url_reviews_comment: Winding road through the mountains. Hairpin curves and switchbacks make it quite the drive. Did I mention the view, awesome!!!

As someone who has been to the Grand Canyon many times I can say this is not even remotely close in comparison. However, it is a very cool canyon and certainly unique. The waterfalls are something you cannot see in the Grand Canyon, at least not for the masses. I found this canyon to be worth the visit.

A must see. Hands down. As anywhere in Yellowstone, expect crowds. I'll say we did meet only very friendly and accommodating people who gave everyone a chance at the "money shots". There are several stops to see this feature from different angles as well.
Wow! This spot is incredible. The hike is super hard though. Make sure you are up to it. It's so pretty. The ground is kinda slippery so make sure you have good traction on your tennis shoes.
I can see why there are so many paintings and pictures of this area and the Yellowstone Falls. Smaller version of the Grand canyon
This is maybe my 6th time here and the canyon area never gets old. The views are phenomenal. Just wish the hike to the brink of the falls wasnt so slippery..a bit dangerous for small kids.

places_url_reviews_title: This is nature at its best
places_url_reviews_comment: Just Visit Yellowstone. Every Nature lover should plan a visit. It really helps you understand evolution of earth and realise that nature is the almighty.

places_url_reviews_title: Not as pretty as the actual Grand Canyon!!
places_url_reviews_comment: We've seen the Grand Canyon but this is nothing compared to that. It is not even that pretty. We did see a bear pretty close to the Canyon so that was amazing. But if it is far from you don't go here.

I see many Canyon and Fall, but the special point here is the color
