Had to stop and visit this site during a recent cross country road trip, it never disappoints one. A hidden favorite!
If you're doing Yellowstone you have to do this little trail. It is part of Yellowstone's grandeur and everywhere you look there's something special. We enjoyed the time spent here.

Just amazing views - felt like we were in the pages of National Geographic magazine.
Not much more to say than don't miss it.

This is an amazing part of the park!
Check it out, take pictures and make sure you walk around the trails around it.

places_url_reviews_title: Fantastic Canyon, IMO better than The Grand Canyon in Arizona
places_url_reviews_comment: I have visit this place during the summer break, then went to Arizona Grand Canyon. In my mind, the Yellowstone is a must-once-in-life visit place. The whole scenery is excellent and unique. The air is clean and fresh. During the trekking, I even saw some of the bear's claw scratch on the tree. Definitely this must be heaven on earth. If I have any chance I will make another visit again and keep my finger crossed that I would run into a bear within a safety distance.
Great place to stop for something to do and look around. Everything from visitor center to general store and restaurant. A little something for everyone .

places_url_reviews_title: Fantastic and better than Grand Canyon
places_url_reviews_comment: I went during summer time with family and wasn't sure whether it's worth all the way going up north but we're simply blown away by the beauty of the canyon. I felt better than Grand Canyon!!!

places_url_reviews_title: Am I Looking at a Postcard?
places_url_reviews_comment: The view of this magnificent water fall is amazing at any lookout point or from any angle. This is what makes Yellowstone so special. There is such a wide diversity of things to see. If you don't visit this side of the park, you won't realize there is a beautiful canyon with many colors and with a waterfall that is still rushing in September. While on this side of the park, see the wild life in Hayden Valley. Wherever you choose to view this magnificent canyon, please stay on the correct side of the rope/handrail. Do not put your life at risk to get the "perfect picture".

places_url_reviews_title: Beautiful! Be sure to visit both upper and lower falls.
places_url_reviews_comment: We enjoyed the hike down to the "Brink of the Falls" for the upper falls, bit the brink hike for the lower falls is crazy difficult! You can see them in all their beauty from afar at Inspiration Point and Artist Point.
Wow what a place to see, takes your breath away, so many different colours in the rocks - our photo of the view is my screen saver!

Now don't get me wrong the Grand Canyon is much grander so I came here not expecting much however I couldn't be more wrong the colors were amazing I had to force myself to put the camera away so I could simply gaze out at the natural beauty. If your at Yellowstone don't miss this its number one for a reason

We were there during a day with rain and snow. View was breathtaking and peaceful. It is certainly deep but enjoyable for die hard hikers. The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is favorite stops for great hiking around the rim but be careful for wildlife. Take precautions accordingly. Steps down to the waterfall are hard. Adequate parking but it could be nightmare in tourist season
This was an unusual attraction that we saw on our Globus bus tour. We did not expect to see this canyon in Yellowstone. It is a prime spot for taking many pictures.

places_url_reviews_title: Not a Grand Canyon, but still great
places_url_reviews_comment:
When I first visited the Park 10 years ago, this was what impressed me the most.
The combination of the water power, canyon geometry and different colors gives a great impression. Definitely try to go to the Artist Point, but the crowds can spoil the whole ting: I was there about 4 PM and it looked and sounded like a market place! Try to go late in the sunset instead (the mornings are for animal watching here).
In terms of getting there - one of the easiest, right at the canyon village, and closest to the East entrance (towards Cody, WY).

places_url_reviews_title: A definite part of any visit to Yellowstone NP
places_url_reviews_comment: This is something that is often said, and I don't often agree with - but in this instance, photographs do not do this place justice. It was way more impressive than I was thinking in the build up to the visit. It is worth seeing from both sides - each offer very different worthwhile experiences. Get up close with the waterfall. The volume of water (both in terms of the capacity and the noise) is extraordinary. Quite a lot of descending to do in both cases, and therefore the return ascent - so bear that in mind before heading down. Wonderful.
The best of Yellowstone - experience both upper and lower falls hikes to awesome views of the deep valley and waterfalls.
We were there during a few days with rain and snow and the waterfall was full and wonderful to see. The view was breathtaking and peaceful. I didn't want to leave that sight.

We go to Artist Point around 10:00am and had a great view of the falls. from there we did Uncle's Tom trail, the brink to the upper fall and the brink to the lower fall, and at last the red rock look out point. There are a lot of steps down and then up on all of these trails, but you must do it to see these falls from all points of view.
Go to the middle vantage point and walk out area to see this picturesque area of Yellowstone and if you catch it in the right light, you'll get some great photos.
We caught this from artists point in the fog, hiked uncle toms trail, and then caught it in the cloudless sunshine. One of our highlights of the park.

places_url_reviews_title: No, it's not a comparison to the "real" Grand Canyon
places_url_reviews_comment: So, enthused by the many reviews I went with too high expectations. Yes, it is certainly deep and impressive. No it isn't one of the seven natural wonders of the world! Enjoy it for what it is, but Yellowstone has much more amazing wonders to behold like Hayden Valley with bison and grizzlies, geyser fields galore and wolves in Lamar Valley.

We love seeing the canyon and waterfalls from different angles. Even amateurs can get fantastic shots here. You can choose easy walking paths or strenuous hikes, depending on your ability. A must see.

The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone was one of my favorite stops in the park. There is so much great hiking around the rim offering breathtaking views. Some of the trails were closed for the season by the time we got there in mid september, but there were so many other trails open, it didn't matter.
If you are going to hike (and I mean really hike, not stopping where the sidewalk ends) the trails, just like everywhere in Yellowstone, be prepared! Have water and bear spray. Try to go in groups and talk loudly to scare off any bears or other wildlife that may be near by. While we didn't see any bears, we saw plenty of things that let us know they were nearby (... big piles of fresh poo...). I don't say that to scare anyone off from hiking. Just be prepared so you can enjoy it!
The steps down to the waterfall are hard, but so worth it! Please seriously consider if you think you are up for it. I am pretty fit and still had to stop coming back up. There are benches in different spots along the way for you to stop and rest. Also consider if you are ok with open heights. The steps are see through and can be a little unnerving if you don't like heights.
There was a good amount of parking. But again, we were there mid September. I've heard horror stories about the summer.
Take the trails and enjoy nature! walking these trails to the water fall was the best part of our visit.

places_url_reviews_title: Wow - worth the long steep hike
places_url_reviews_comment: GC of Y is simply gorgeous. You can easily see why it is called Yellow'. From the parking lot there is a healthy moderately steep switchback trail and it is worth the hike down and then, of course, back up. You are right at the falls with the roar and mist - great photo opps and quite magical place. Also hike the other side along the rim for spectacular views.

Yes that is what we experienced when we reached and hiked along the rim here. You will just keep on looking at the falls and the valley and will have little time to talk with your party. The beauty of nature will engulf you in silence.
as you go down the stairs the falls look different. As you hike along the rim, each vista point will give you a different view and perspective. You will also hike between some geothermal area which is kind of neat.
Overall a great hike and great views.
For the better view, you need to get to the view point and look around. The fall looks great from different angles. From the video point, if you look to the right, you see color walls of the canyon.

What a beatyfull spot !!! It's a 1/2 mile walk to a lookout point make the path for a great lookout area wher you look one wat you see a 309 ft waterfalls neayufill. Like the other way you see a yellow walls of the canon .

This area as well a the rest of the park is simply magnificent. The Yellowstone national park and all of its sites are nothing short of the ultimate place to visit. There is nothing to say but make it a bucket list spot and go in may after snow is off roads and you will be able to see all the wildlife of the park
We were lucky enough to be there while it was snowing, which was a unique look. The views are truly amazing. A must-see when in Yellowstone Nat'l Park.

Boy I was not expecting this. We spent 5 weeks in West USA & Canada, along with the rain forest on Vancouver Island this was the best placed visited amongst loads of fantastic sites. People go to Yellowstone for the ‘bubbly water’….but this was just mind blowing
We were there in rain then turned to snow. So we chose not to walk the trails. The canyon is so deep and color is beautiful. I wish to have a chance to walk the trails later.

places_url_reviews_title: Worth the stop, short hike, beautiful scenary.
places_url_reviews_comment: This never fails to amaze me how beautiful this area is and what nature is capable of creating. Worth the steps to get there and the crowd fighting and patience for a picture.

A Bucket List to be checked!! Bisons, Bears, Foxes, Wolves, Swans and Wild Ducks - animals watch - excellent for little children as well as for all ages. Stay at lease 2 days to a week to explore the park!
Beautiful lake for pictures!
Don't miss the Good Old Faithful and many more!!

places_url_reviews_title: Grand Canyon is well worth the drive and the walk
places_url_reviews_comment: When you are driving through the park, you just have to go see this part of the park. The views are breathtaking and the sounds are glorious.

places_url_reviews_title: Great view of canyon and falls
places_url_reviews_comment: Must see view of canyon and falls (from Artist Point). There is also a canyon drive and you can hike various trails and down to the falls itself. The hikes are a bit steep if you are out of shape. A must see.

I went there with my friend.
Uncle Tom trail is very steep , easy to go down hard to clim up. Still fun .
There is not one part of Yellowstone that is not amazing. The falls are beautiful. The scenery is not paralled anywhere else in the USA.
This site provides excellent opportunity to get some fantastic photos. A beautiful waterfall, the Yellowstone River, and a deep canyon provide great subject matter.
This is a fantastic site to visit in Yellowstone! We only got to spend a few minutes here but it was absolutely worth it. Check it out!

places_url_reviews_title: Words and Photos do not do it justice, you must experience it!
places_url_reviews_comment: This was the first time for me to travel west. My traveling companion has been to the area several times. After being back home now for a couple weeks, I am still in awe over the beauty that encompasses Yellowstone. From making the hike down the switchbacks to the lower falls, to the sweeping vistas of artist point, looking back at the falls where we had just stood, feeling the power of the rushing water, it is nothing less then awe inspiring. If you want to find yourself becoming emotional over the absolute beauty that is available to all of us in this country, this is the place for that to happen.

Amazing natural beauty here and well worth the time to visit. The vivid colors in the earth, the Lower and Upper Falls, so many spots for photographs! We had no idea this would be such a grand sight as it doesn't get the press or attention that Old Faithful gets. Probably the most beautiful area of Yellowstone National Park.

Prior to this, I had never seen a canyon before. It was absolutely breathtaking. Wish we had time to do some of the longer hikes to get away from the crowd. We did the north side overlook. The switchbacks were literally breathtaking... lol but so worth it.
Got to see the falls this year just after a fresh snow storm, the site was so beautiful with the canyon colors and the snow.

It was a steep walk down to view the lower falls but worth every step when we got there. The beauty of the falls is amazing. The walk back up was helped by benches along the way and a chance to catch our breath! Don't miss this incredible wonder.

places_url_reviews_title: Beautiful Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone
places_url_reviews_comment: Loved it. So pretty. The colors of the different rock layers is amazing. Hike both trails, the Northern Rim and the Southern Rim for different view of the canyon and the falls.
A short walk from the parking lot to the stone wall that runs along the path, will bring you to the lookout that gives you this amazing view of the Falls. Do not miss this!
The 300 foot falls (Yellowstone River) are spectacular, and the walls of the canyon with all their beautiful coloration are breathtaking. Well worth going to see!

The park is beautiful. We spent 2 days and went thru 1 loop each day. Signs are sparse-only at intersections- and the speed limit is usually 45 mph....this is great for the animals that will meander across the road and as traffic stops look for wildlife. Mammoth Springs was AMAZING.

places_url_reviews_title: Yep, There is Another Grand Canyon
places_url_reviews_comment: Everything about Yellowstone seems to be very big and the canyon is no exception. Okay, so it's not "THE" Grand Canyon, but it is still very beautiful and quite impressive. Make sure you stop to tale a look when you're in the park.
Waterfalls that were magnificent-colored rock- awe struck by the beauty of the whole area. Make sure you ride around the whole area-north and south sides. Photo opportunities galore.

Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is a pleasant surprise in that it lives up to the pictures that you see posted everywhere. There are numerous overlook locations and plenty of hiking trails for all abilities. We took a Ranger-led walk on the South Rim and it was very enjoyable and informative.

If you only have 2 days to spend in the park, one of them has to be at Canyons. This is a fabulous area. This was our 3rd trip to Yellowstone & we came here all 3 times.
Canyons is a very busy place. I would recommend the same advice I give to everyone : when visiting a busy national park GET UP EARLY!! Shower the night before. Eat a light breakfast (not in a restaurant) & get over there!! In the summer this place is jump'in.
There are 2 main areas. The North Rim & South Rim. Both are equally beautiful, but due to construction, we've spent more time at the South Rim. The parking area in the South Rim is huge. The view of the Lower Falls spectacular. There's a few day hikes you can access at this point. The Canyon Rim South Trail is 3.5 miles one way, but fantastic views can be seen at many points on the trail. Walk a little way & then go back when you get tired.
The North Rim parking is a problem. If you go later in the day, you will have stress. This road is one way traffic only. Inspiration Point is a highlight. There's also the North Rim Trail, which is 3 miles one way. There's also a lot of great views.
Canyons has a large shopping area, with restaurants, the General Store, an outdoor outfitter & the Visitor Center. There's also a campground with laundry & showers.

our highlight possibly as there were less people but none the less it is extraordinary. There are boardwalks and wooden stairs on either side which go quite a way down giving beautiful views of the canyon. Wear sensible shoes..don't forget water and sunscreen.
A really must visit destination eminently reachable attraction, walk down to the top of the lower falls it is worth the effort

places_url_reviews_title: Awe-inspiring views that launched the idea of national parks in 1872
places_url_reviews_comment: Pack a picnic lunch, you'll be out all day. The bare rocks of the Yellowstone "grand" Canyon are truly golden yellow, (and in places even tangerine orange and russet red), hence "Yellow stone". We walked to a viewpoint along the Uncle Tom's Cabin Trail, and could see the Yellowstone River clearly as it pelted over a steep precipice and into the gorge below. We followed the trail down a winding track, the air scented with pine resin, almost to the base of the falls. After a mile or so, the path stopped abruptly, 380 steps on several steel connected platforms took us to the valley floor, where the spray creates misty rainbows. Not suitable for anyone with vertigo.

If you ever get a chance to visit Yellowstone you really need to see ALL of it! Old Faithful is great but there is so much more to the park than that. The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is so amazing. You only have to let your imagination go and you will realize how incredible our world really is. Norris Geysers are so amazing also. You will do some walking but so worth it! Just think that you are walking on the boardwalks above the worlds larger volcano!!! Think about that for a minute....must put it on your bucket list!

The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone was scenic stop on our Caravan Bus Tour. I was truly stunned and speechless. I'll have to agree with everything that has been said by the other reviewers, at the risk of sounding repetitive. Take a good camera and give yourself plenty of time to soak in this beautiful attraction.

places_url_reviews_title: Cool~~~Spectacular Canyon to travel in autumn
places_url_reviews_comment: It was a breathtaking experience to Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone, rapid watering with special trees around. From the upper fall to the lower fall, there are colorful rocks like oil paintings. The best location to appreciate the grand canyon is the Artist Point.

This is such a beautiful location also for walking a trail, very nice scenery and you can spend all day here.
The further up the trail the more quiet it becomes.
The park is amazing all around and this is an imperative part to include. Many easy/steep paths at your discretion. Don't miss!
very easy to view in Sept/off season but it must be awful in peak season to be able to view safely but that is also why we went in sept

In the eastern part of the park we hiked the trail to the sheer cliffs and waterfalls of Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. There were significant crowds that summer Thursday braving the somewhat steep and windy trails down then back up again. The platforms at the base by the waterfall revealed the expansive views of the canyon valley stretching for miles. There is another viewing platform on the other side that is accessed through another vantage point. It was good for a little while to get outside and see some awesome scenery.

I hiked all the the paths down to the water below and stopped at all viewpoints. Hikes are not real bad although coming back up can be a bit of a chore. Thought this was the best views in all of Yellowstone especially when viewing from the top of the lower falls.

The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone was amazing. A short 0.6 mile hike uphill to the Artist Point gave great views in any directions. A must see, there were trails as well but I didn't do any of them due to time. Ranger was at the Artist Point to give info and ranger talks about the canyon.
Fantastic and awesome experience; unbelievable view that takes your breath away! I took a picture with my phone, and the photo was phenomenal, but not because of me.....God's work.

Do not miss this place. We were not expecting much when we hiked into the canyon, but what we saw at the bottom was amazing! You can stand right at the top of the lower falls and the view into the canyon is one of the coolest things we have ever seen. More than worth the hiking effort.
Great spot for pictures, the view was awesome and worth the stairs involved. Beautiful spot to visit.

places_url_reviews_title: We enjoyed this beautiful unforgettable sight.
places_url_reviews_comment: The grand canyon of yellowstone was a wonderful stop. We spent a couple hours admiring the views, taking pictures and came home with many great captured moments to remember.

places_url_reviews_title: Much bigger, grander and more stunning in real life
places_url_reviews_comment:
We walked from the canyon village to the rim which is actually a bit tricky because the path isn't signed. A helpful staff member pointed the route. (around a mile?) it does however avoid the problem of car parking on the rim side lookouts which can be very busy.
When you step out to see the canyon it is Oh so Yellow, and Oh so vast !
there are steps down in places for a better view if the waterfall. Not to be missed. On a cautious note the barrier is quite low in places.
Beautiful Canyon,with wonderful water fall. The different rocks making up this canyon, and their beautiful colors make this a must see spot in Yellowstone Park.
Beautiful, colorful and really big! Also very popular. Very cold the last few days si bring your serious cold weather gear. The snow is really magnificent.
One of the best attractions in the park. Unlike some of the others you can get good photos even in poor weather. The falls are spectacular and the views are beautiful. The walk is very manageable.
A must see if visiting Yellowstone NP. Amazing natural beauty. Plenty of picture taking opportunities.

There are some amazing views of the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone and some of the best are from Artist Point.
This was one of my favorite locations in Yellowstone.
It snowed the day we were there making the entire canyon beautiful as the snow came down and covered the canyon walls.
We tried as many stops as we could along the canyon. There's a fairly short walk to the lower falls that is worth doing. Overall, breathtaking and worth the time.
This was taken from Artist Point. We were unable to go on hike down to bottom of the falls because of icing of the train IN JUNE! We were not prepared for how chilly it was in June.

A half hour trek among nature, trees, squirrels, birds and wind ... and at the very end the amazing waterfall. A fresh ... strong waterfall on the Yellowstone River, outlet of the Lake of the same name. The vertical yellow walls of the canyon are a sight in themselves. The color of the rocks give name to the Park

places_url_reviews_title: Truly beautiful even on a cloudy day
places_url_reviews_comment:
The pictures don't do this canyon justice. Amazing views from many different overlooks and trails. Some are wheelchair accessible so everyone can see it. Trails and long stairways to lower vantage points for those who are more adventurous.
Definitely a don't miss!
To visit the Yellowstone Park is just a dream. The nature and landscape is breath taking and you will see the wildlife and beautiful canyons. MUST SEE

We joined on to a Park Ranger-led tour that told us a lot about the ecology and flora of the area. We decided not to go to the bottom of the canyon (there is a way to go to the bottom on both the north and south sides). Both sides appear to be quite strenuous, even the one with stairs.

Absolutely beautiful! The waterfalls will take your breath away, and are all easy to reach from the road.
Awesome place!
We did the walk down on uncle Tom's trail - not for the faint hearted and more physically challenging than we thought ! But the views are truly amazing.

Beautiful falls and gorge showing many different shades of colors showing off the many minerals in the cliffs. Usually very busy with tour buses with folks from all over the world. Fun to people watch.

Parking area really congested, but you have to see this. Every time I tried to get over where I could get an unobstructed view to take a picture, someone would push their way in front of me. Took awhile to get pictures. After that we had a nice long conversation with a park ranger and learned about some of the hiking trails nearby.

This is so spectacular and breathtaking. The colors are amazing when the sun hits it just right and I was able to get some amazing photos. You can't believe how grand it is so be sure to view it from the north and south rim and make sure you stop at every vantage point!
Access is very easy for a view of the falls. There are paths down to the water level for those willing to make the climb back afterwards. However it is a good point for sunrises - given a clear dawn.

places_url_reviews_title: Beautiful scenery, well worth the drive.
places_url_reviews_comment: As we were driving in Yellowstone Park to the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone we had a minor traffic jam. One single bison was just walking down the center of the road. I didn't mind the delay at all as everyone that passed him had to slow and of course take a picture. Very fun! And the spectacular view of the canyon itself with the waterfall and river was wonderful. If you are up to a steep hike back up the paths make sure you try it. I only went 1/3 of the way and huffed and puffed all the way back up.

This was our first trip to Yellowstone. There are so many awesome sites, it is hard to say which stop is number one. This might be it. In addition to Artists Point, check out the many waterfall overlooks. This is a must see!

This was my first trip to Yellowstone National Park and the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone was a pleasant surprise and a must see from both the north and south side, completely different views.
Is it the "Grand Canyon" of the west, certainly not but it's breathtaking nonetheless and a must see if you travel to Yellowstone.

The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is one of the must see sites when visiting. It is best viewed while staying at Canyon, as you must view both the North and South Rims. You can just walk out to the overlooks or go for a full on walk around the rims. Would recommend that you build in plenty of time here to take in all the sites and go for longer hikes to get all the views, There are plenty of parking spots, but most of the hiking is out and back, as there are no shuttles. The scenery is absolutely stunning, in anyone's language. The North rim is a one way road, back to Canyon Village. Do not overlook the Brink of the falls walks.

Don’t miss this. It is one of the truly amazing parts of Yellowstone.
Hint1: There are many locations to view the canyon. Visit them all. They give completely different views. It is truly amazing.
Hint2: Don't worry about the crowds. There are many areas with easy access and fences that tend to be a bit crowded, but people move on and you will get to the front to see the views.
Hint3: To avoid the crowds, hit the paths. There are many uncrowded paths where you can walk right up to the edge of a cliff and look down without any fence or barrier. Everywhere you go and look, the views are unbelievable.
Hint4: Take a ton of pictures, but don’t expect them to replicate the beauty and depth of the canyon. Looking at the photos and videos I took, the videos do a much better job of capturing the depth, color and size of the area.

Enjoyed a ranger-led hike with our kids along the south rim of the canyon. The ranger was very interesting and informative; the group was not too big. Scenery was beautiful. We continued hiking along the south rim as far as Artists Point
The canyon is particularly scenic and spectacular, but the whole park just 'takes your breath away'. It is worth the walk down to the waterfalls.
Make sure to travel both the south and north side roads for spectacular views. Tis does not require a lot of hiking as the viewpoints are very accessible with short walks.

In a country with so much to see you become a bit critical. So no I don't think this was an amazing and must-see sight. Okay it's a pretty canyon and you should stop by when you're in Yellowstone since you're gonna drive past it anyway, but it's not the highlight of the park.
One of the best views in Yellowstone. A must stop. This isn't like the other stops where hot springs are the attraction.
You simply have to take in the views of Yellowstone's Grand Canyon. The scenery is stunning. Highly recommended
This is a beautiful area of Yellowstone and is well worth visiting. The waterfall is stunning. I've been told that the best time to visit for photography is in the morning and sunset.

places_url_reviews_title: One of the easiest great views to get to
places_url_reviews_comment: A short easy walk to an excellent view of the canyon. With it being so easy to access, there is no reason to miss.

So beautiful!! Our photos did not do it justice!! If you take small children keep a very close eye on them as there are no railings past the initial viewpoint and the walk is along cliff tops. I would highly recommend this.
This is a must with amazing views and not a long walk. Beautiful colouring in the mountainside on the sides of the canyons. Really lovely views.

We parked at the upper parking area on the North Rim Drive and walked the trail (nice trek with a sheer drop towards the River below, pine trees and a squirrel too!) to the Lookout point and back. Great views of the Fall

The greatest experience is Artists Point. Going to Yellowstone National Park is the greatest of National Park experiences. The best spot to observe the falls remains Artists Point. A very short walk and the greatest of views in the park. Just relax and recognize that you will have lots of folks that mostly travel in groups. Just wade through the crowds and take some pictures there.

places_url_reviews_title: Far more impressive than the hype
places_url_reviews_comment: Really worth the very short drive to see. Morning is best to get full sun on the north facing falls. Allow an hour to an hour and a help for the upper and lower falls.
Beautiful unbelievable views! It is a must-see! Little Kids would make me nervous here if unattended.
The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is absolutely Breath Taking and you need to make sure that if you are visiting Yellowstone that you add it to your itinerary.
This is one of the must sees on your tour around Yellowstone. The Great Loop Road gives the best views in my opinion.

places_url_reviews_title: Add this to the must see list
places_url_reviews_comment: Don't miss this while traveling in Yellowstone. It was one of my favorites! Breathtaking views. Go up to Artist Point for fabulous views. Can't say enough about this place! AWESOME!!!
Make sure you stop at Artist Point on south rim - great views. This is a must see and if you are able the trails down to the falls looked really cool.
Stunning views of the waterfall especially from the North Rim but all viewing areas offer interesting features.

When you come upon this canyon it is breathless. The hiking trails are well maintained and worth the trip. The history of how this canyon was formed is amazing. We are lucky to have national parks and forests.
Take your time and enjoy the views. Don't spend all your time taking selfies, experience the moment and the spectacular scenery.

We spent the day in Yellowstone, but ended our journey at the Grand Canyon. The views are breathtaking! I encourage you to drive all the way around and stop at the different view points. The gradual climb up to the larger falls is worth it!
We were so amazed to see the canyon. So majestic and beautiful. It was incredible and a must see. Worth the trip
The falls and the canyon are spectacular! I would recommend both the north and south rim drives. All overlooks are so wonderful.

We were mesmerized by the views and the historical information on the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. There are well maintained pathways that bring you right up to the brink of the canyon. I even had a little trouble with vertigo. Excellent displays of magma deposits and striatum. Beautiful views of the river below.

This is one of the highlights of the park. It is nowhere near the size of the real Grand Canyon, but it is still so beautiful and majestic. There is a north rim and a south rim. We went to the south rim. When you enter the road to view the canyon you are now on a one way loop road that takes you back to the Canyon Village area. Be sure to look for the stairway on the opposite side that goes half way down the rock face to a small platform. Only for the brave! Also look for the lower falls. Stunning!

Been here three times from SoCal. One time for myself and twice more as a family guide. I enjoyed Yellowstone more than Yosemite, Grand Canyon or even Rocky Mountain although they have less visitors. Might be due to it's location. Simply driving thru the "number 8" shape scenic loop gave me lot of fun. It's a huge park. All three times I visited, I entered the park at 8am and finished the complete loop at around 6 or 7pm depends on the traffic. I took almost all small roads where car can enter thru. I like this park because I don't have to walk too far too see things. So it's great place like myself who hates walking too much during the vacation (I take vacation to relax). Most of the viewing can be done from inside the car or by very short walk. Be forewarn that this park has lot of Park Ranger action compare to other parks. I never seen so many visitors get pulled over(assuming speeding) like in this park. They come out from nowhere like the highway patrols. If you're there for just one day, then do the counter-clock drive. It's a better side for viewing and entering view points. If you begin before 8am you should be able to view all the popular attractions and finish the "8" loop by 7pm. If you're lucky you'll catch Old Faithful eruption as well. At one visit I tried to complete full loop and reverse back loop in one day but couldn't unless I'm the only one in the park, and without speed limit. You will definitely see Bisons but I noticed huge number of them come out on the road just before sunset when most visitors are gone. And lastly, don't make a mistake of not visiting Grand Teton National Park right below the Yellowstone.
When you pull up to the Canyon area and get out of your car expect your jaw to drop. Such a beautiful place. Probably my favorite area in Yellowstone.
Our guide took us to one of the lookout points of the Yellowstone Grand Canyon. Absolutely majestic views of the falls, the river, the walls. Spectacular. Unbelievable photo-op.
Lots of visitors frequent this amazing vista and take photos at Artists Point. I recommend going at sunrise on a cloudy day as the light is amazing and the steam from the falls is at a minimum.

This is what I pictured when we decided to visit this park . It is absolutely amazing and humbling to see the power of nature . We walked down to the rim of the lower falls which is 3/8 of a mile with about 10 switchbacks on the trail . The walk down was strenuous for me because of physical limitations , but it was worth it . The view at the bottom is awesome . The walk up was harder on my lungs but easier on my body . Do this walk if you have the chance . The canyon is truly wonderful . There are several spots to see the falls, upper and lower , and to enjoy the beauty of this canyon . Loved it !

Drove in through South Rim, the oneway path to witness this magnificent canyon view. I arrived at the sunset, the king cliff has already put on his golden cloak longing for a romantic struggle with his snake river soulmate.
A great stop in the park. Short walks for most views (unless going to base of Lower Falls...ouch). Worth the effort

So beautiful and powerful to see the wonder of nature at work. Yellowstone has done a great job providing access to the many viewpoints on both sides of the canyon. I would recommend taking both loops to see the different views that include the waterfalls, the mighty Yellowstone river, the awesome colorful canyon and the almost hidden thermals at the bottom. This is a must see for all park visitors!

Lovely area to hike and take in the unique beauty of the falls. Discovered a backcountry hot spot on the south rim that we'd never seen before. Hike along the rim from artists point for .8 miles and turn right. Very interesting scenery from the pond back towards the parking area at Uncle Tom's

places_url_reviews_title: Amazing views and worth going to all the viewpoints.
places_url_reviews_comment: There are many access points and trails available and it is worth visiting them all. The depth of the canyon itself is quite amazing as is the volume of water pouring over the upper falls. You can take a short walk down to the spot where there is an overlook above the main falls and look up to the viewpoints on the other side and vice versa.
When in Yellowstone make to go and see the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. Obviously not as large as the G.C. But truly a wonder of nature. Can be windy in that area, take lots of pictures
The waterfall and surrounding areas are stunning. The landscape views are extraordinary. Lots of parking. Restrooms available. There are stairs to get to the upper viewing area. A very nice stop.

places_url_reviews_title: Wow what a unique deep canyon.
places_url_reviews_comment: This place is beautiful and a must visit while in Yellowstone. The best place to see it may be from Artist Point but there are plenty of viewpoints on both sides. Spectacular colors.

What a beautiful place! So many great place to take pictures and the stones are pure YELLOW How Yellowston got its name for sure. The colors are spectacular! Lots of walking but very much worth the views you will see!

There is a one way drive which gives good views over the canyon and the waterfall.
There are obviously some great hikes but those who are less able can still get a good view from the rim. Amazing, a must if you are visiting the park.

places_url_reviews_title: Majestic canyon with waterfalls and Yellowstone river
places_url_reviews_comment: Can't believe that here is a grand canyon in the deep of YSP. Seems that the land just lifts up impressively from the basin to the elevated hill, forming the canyon with Yellowstone river inside and the scenic views as well. It'a wonderful place to view the waterfall from the viewing deck on the top. BTW, Yellowstone River flows to the north and will merge to Madison river in Montana, then join Missouri River and Mississippi River in Missouri. So considered by the length, Yellowstone or Madison River is one of the fountainheads of Mississippi River.
The views are the best in Yellowstone Park, one way you into the canyon is a superb waterfall, whilst in the other direction is craggy and colourful.

We got here the day after a light snowfall and it was stunningly beautiful. There are several places to park and take photos. Artist point was the best but don't skip the other places. I suggest avoiding summer school vacation times to avoid crowding.
Had not been here in years. Enjoyed the hiking and views. Knowing where to see the best views is key. Ask the staff

Easy walk from the parking lot. Not difficult to see at all. The overlooks have railings, but if you're afraid of heights beware. The edge of the overlook is a complete vertical drop off.
My wife and I thought the view resembled a painting, with awesome views of the river.

places_url_reviews_title: Artist point was the best place to view
places_url_reviews_comment: I was surprised that Yellowstone river has this beautiful teal green color. Artist point was the best place to view. Summer is a busy time to visit. Go early morning or evening to have less visitors sharing the space with you

places_url_reviews_title: I could not believe anything the beautiful existed in the USA - amazing
places_url_reviews_comment: This place took my breath away. Go to Artists' Point. You won't be disappointed. If you go nowhere else in Yellowstone, go here!

Nature at its finest.... Could sit and stare at the waterfalls and beautiful canyons for hours...no wonder it is a favorite location for artists. This is a heavily visited site but you don't feel cramped after you get away from the parking area.... Not to be missed when visiting the park.

places_url_reviews_title: LOVE THE SOUND OF RUSHING WATER
places_url_reviews_comment: The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone was our last stop on the CIRCLE OF FIRE TOUR of the lower loop. It was beautiful and a little bit of a walk after a full day on and off the YELLOWSTONE tour bus.
Beautiful falls and surrounding vistas. Short walk off the pullout so it it accessible to everyone. Impressive to say the least.

I walked the upper trail, it offers fabulous views of the falls and a peaceful, deep forest experience. Stopped and watched a squirrel chewing an acorn like a drill bit :). It is not too challenging for a non hiker.

Save your money and go to Iceland. It is much cheaper and much more beautiful. Yellowstone in a tourist trap - about $700 per day including overpriced motels, food, and entrance fees. If you are a geologist then it would be worth the money because there are a lot of interesting volcanic events happening. Also go in September to avoid the crowds and long lines.

We downloaded this app for under 5 dollars and it was fabulous. We had our own knowledgeable tour guide right in our car with us. Do yourself a favour and check it out online. We are in Teton now and GyPSy is expertly guiding us again.
Yellowstone - Overall, scenery stunning, lots of buffalo & elk (very few 'visible' bears) but HUNDREDS of cars and people.
This is not a wilderness - it's a huge safari park but still enjoyable.
Grand Canyon a must!

Very pretty, a must-do in Yellowstone National Park, along with exploring Hayden and Lamar Valleys and hiking.
This can be very busy-try to do at times when there are less visitors
It had snowed the day we arrived so it was an added bonus to see this place with and without snow. It is the prettiest place in Yellowstone, not to be missed
The rimtrails are really worth a walk, the stone is so colourful no matter at what point you are standing.

Absolutely spectacular vistas of the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. Have visited here four times over 35 years and still spectacular. Great access and parking. Easy in and out for a drive by. Multiple views.

places_url_reviews_title: Hike the North and South Rims
places_url_reviews_comment: The observation points are nice but the rim hiking is flat and you get away front the crowds. Evening is nice too. Short drive from Canyon Lodge

Wasn't sure until I saw it. It is not on the size of The Grand Canyon but I would recommend visiting this place. It is small yet magnificent. The viewing area could become crowded so avoid when the big busses roll around. In a certain way, I liked it more than the Grand Canyon.
Simply amazing photo ops from the viewing park area, very busy even in September but do stop as it's worth it

We hiked along the canyon seeing the upper and lower falls in addition to the canyon itself with it's geologic colors. Frankly, we hadn't anticipated the canyon being as grand and majestic as it was. A pleasant surprise and compliment to the other natural wonders of the park

Whether known by this name, or as Artist Point, or as Upper Falls, this is an iconic and must-see location. Be prepared to take the short walk from the parking lot (ramps are available as alternatives to stairs), and spend at least an hour there just drinking in the breathtaking scenery.

places_url_reviews_title: A must do stop in Yellowstone
places_url_reviews_comment: There are three different pullouts that you can easily do to see the brink of the falls, the upper falls, and by the Canyon lodge area the north rim. You will see rocks formations and colors that we saw no where else in the park. Paths are short and easy. Uncle Toms Trail, the 300+ steps that you can take to see the falls closer was closed, but we weren't going to do those anyway. While you are here the Canyon Lodge gift shop had a nice selection and a clearance rack. I got made in the usa tshirts fot $6.99. My kind of shopping.

places_url_reviews_title: impressive views of the falls. VERY crowded in summer
places_url_reviews_comment:
The great loop road just south of Canyon village takes you past several good view points of both the upper and lower falls of the Yellowstone river. The upper falls viewpoint is distant, but a level hike of approximately 1 mile takes you to a much more interesting viewpoint.
A hike with a drop of 600 feet takes you to the top of the lower falls from this viewpoint, where you can stand on the lip of the lower falls,
The lower falls are by far the more impressive, being the iconic picture of the Yellowstone river.
The lower falls viewpoint gives an excellent view of the lower falls with minimal walking.
The great loop road tends to be extremely congested and parking can be a hassle, but the views are worth the effort.
This was a beautiful photo stop. The waterfall empties into the canyon below, and the rock formations are amazing.
A wonderful view of the Lower Yellowstone Falls & this is where you can see why it is called YELLOWstone NP
I loved the canyon. Due to erosion you can see different layers on the other side. And you can see breath taking views up and down the canyon with its yellowish walls. Very nice.
This is certainly worth a visit while in Yellowstone. We have some great photos of the waterfall and also the colourful rock on the other side. Just a short walk.

places_url_reviews_title: Grand views but not quite the Grand Canyon in Arizona
places_url_reviews_comment: Breathtaking and accessible thanks to the Parks peopl'e. Every stop on the road is little or no hiking to a great viewpoint. Off the main road you can choose to take the South loop of North loop. If you only take one take the South loop as it takes in Uncle Tom's Trail and Artist Point. Note the North loop becomes a one way loop that heads into the Canyon Lodge area which is convenient if you are staying there. Do not violate the rules of staying on the trails or viewing viewing area fencing. It is enticing but people have died in these areas that are very safe. Go early to get better vibes and easier picture taking as when the tour buses arrive it sort of disturbs the pleasure a bit. Note that Uncle Tom's trail can scare people because of the alerts of the 358 or so steps can be exhausting, it is not as bad as it sounds, so go ahead it is worth it, just take your time.

Breath-taking view your eyes cannot believe what you are seeing, very photographic, short walk mostly level take your time some pull-outs fill up parking might be limited if you have a big rv,restrooms limited some attractions have them see map
Nothing can outdo nature! The falls are absolutely beautiful. It is well worth stopping at this point of interest in Yellowstone.
This is such a beautiful canyon and the falls are always magnificent. It's always been a great photo opportunity. The colors here are awesome and the atmosphere is inspiring.
While not comparable to the Grand Canyon in Arizona, the Canyon in Yellowstone was a scenic viewpoint which we enjoyed

We went mi-morning around 10/11am and we were able to find a parking spot without much trouble, surprisingly. We started with Uncle Tom's trail which had 300+ stairs, but was worth it. We were able to get good views of the falls and we saw the rainbow while we were there. We also walked the south rim trail, but if you're short on time, I would just drive to Uncle Tom's Trail and then drive to inspiration point. On the south rim trail you only get the same view at different distances, basically.
Didn't realize the beauty of this place until I saw the real Grand Canyon. The combination of the water, the size of the mountain, trees and a blue sky is truly spectacular
This area is one among several in Yellowstone that merit some attention and certainly offers great photo opportunities.

We hiked the trails on the South Rim. Best views on this side. The climb down to the base of the falls is 328 steps from Uncle Toms trail and not for the faint hearted but is amazing. We walked about halway to Artists point which was a really enjoyable hike butcrealised the kids (7 and 5) woukdnt make it there and back so returned to the car and drove there. Tge views there are beautiful. This was our favourite part of Yellowstone.

places_url_reviews_title: One of the best highlights of the park, a must see
places_url_reviews_comment: If you only see one thing in Yellowstone while you are there, make sure this is it. It is a spectacular setting, very remote, and extremely pristine. The wildlife viewing was great and it was a good place to hike.

places_url_reviews_title: Hike the .8 mile down! the vibration on the deck next to the falls makes you feel small
places_url_reviews_comment: the zig-zag hike down is easy and the view just keeps getting better and better until you get to the lip of the thundering falls. Then it's incredible! The hike back up will wear you out (altitude mainly) but is so worth it.

places_url_reviews_title: One of the prietiest places in the Park
places_url_reviews_comment: We toured both the North and South rim's of the canyon. Different views of the Falls - both beautiful. More active folks hiked to the falls - we just took too many pictures! We also saw an Osprey nest on top of a rock pinnacle with babies still in it and Mom coming to feed the, Fantastic sight. Be sure and bring the best pair of binoculars you can find.

places_url_reviews_title: *** Accessible View of the Falls - Artist Point ***
places_url_reviews_comment:
Loved this trip which is so close to Canyon Campground in Yellowstone! It'd be a crime to not stop here. If you are coming to see to the falls, traveling around noon or early afternoon DOES make for good pictures!
Also, when you first pull into the lot for Artist Point, it is tempting to take the first parking spot you see, but in reality, the attraction is at the very back of the parking lot. It is accessible and me and my kneerover were able to easily see and photograph what I came for! Fantastic!
There are several viewpoints of this magnificent Canyon. Be sure to enjoy each and every one of them.

Grand Canyon of Yellowstone has 2 falls, Upper and Lower. We visited only Lower falls area. There is a small trail that leads to the head of lower falls. You get to see the complete valley and the canyon. I would not recommend this trail with stroller kids or picked up kids as it is a steep uphill trail while walking back. I was speechless after being there and I'm sure anyone would be too, Mesmerizing!!!

places_url_reviews_title: Time it right to see the Rainbow
places_url_reviews_comment: From late May to early September, a rainbow appears on the Lower Falls of the Yellowstone river. For me, it was at 9:40 AM MDT. It is a truly beautiful experience and worth planning for your trip.
This area is overwhelming. I call it a sensory overload. If you travel to Yellowstone you must see he canyon

This was included in our vacation, and we enjoyed it immensely! It was spectacular views from the car and on foot it was breathtaking. So much wildlife to see and just one great scene after another. We can't wait to go back to Yellowstone

places_url_reviews_title: A must see. Artist point was just gorgeous.
places_url_reviews_comment:
You must go and see this place and witness sheer beauty.
Do not miss Uncle Toms trail, its worth doing.

Hike the entire loop for wonderful views of the rivers and falls. We've encountered bison along this hike once or twice, but mainly just wonderful views away from the bulk of the summer crowds. The hike is easy/moderate. We usually bring a picnic lunch to have part way through and finish with ice cream in Canyon Village.

places_url_reviews_title: Amazing place, perhaps best of Yellowstone.
places_url_reviews_comment: South rim views were amazing! Uncle Tom's trail is challenging but worth it, not for the out of shape tourist. Go early to miss the crowds. This was only second to Old Faithful for crowds. Would do the whole rim on both sides if time/family allowed. Consider going north and hiking up to Mount Washburn the same day - also a great excursion.

places_url_reviews_title: This really is worth the stopping and doing the hiking
places_url_reviews_comment:
An amazing canyon with a wonderful waterfall and the colors of the walls and how the river has carved out this canyon are worth every minute driving to this place. The parking isn't as bad here as other places, but because of the tour buses stopping here, the crowds will be bigger. That isn't bad though it will be a multicultural event with everyone asking to have their picture taken with the waterfall and river back ground in all kinds of different languages. Mostly lots of pointing and hand waving trying to communicate with each other. We really had a great time in the crowds and after they dispersed we did some of the hikes and enjoyed getting up and close to some of the water features down in the canyon it self. All we spent more time here than any place else at YNP.
The Good: wonderful views of the canyon with an impressive water fall flowing into a striking blue river.
The Bad: Should have spent more time here than other places in the park
The ugly: Parking can be "interesting" in peak crowds
On the scuba bubble scale of 1 to 10, I give this canyon 8 bubbles

Great hiking on the south rim, do the Uncle Tom's Cabin trail!
Did rent the bear spray, better to be safe then sorry.
This part of the park is not to be missed, everything here is so great. Take your time and get this in your visit

places_url_reviews_title: Great views - worth the hike and the crowds
places_url_reviews_comment:
The steep canyon walls are colored by the geothermal activity and the rushing blue water makes for a spectacular view. Decided to back-track to after heading down to Old Faithful in the morning and we are glad we did. Was well worth the additional time it took.
Watch the signs and be aware that the best views of the "brink" of the falls are from the first parking lot you pull in to. We had to circle around the loop twice because we missed the signs that are immediately on the right as you pull in to the upper lot. Once you arrive in the lot there are a lot of overlooks and trails that offer various angles of the canyon and falls. A thorough visit can be accomplished in 1.5 - 2 hours.
Take good shoes and a good camera!

places_url_reviews_title: Don't miss it, it's just amazing.
places_url_reviews_comment: We enjoyed the animals and thermal features in Yellowstone and thought we'd have a look at this on the way round. It was a wow moment. We'll worth visiting, I'd you're short on time take the south ride and go to Uncle Tom's Trail for stunning views.
There are several great viewing areas for the canyon and falls the best being one one the north rim which brings you right on top of the falls.
Amazing!!! Get there in the early morning for that rainbow effect at the bottom of the Lower Falls. If you can do the Uncle Tom's trail to the bottom.

Dont miss this wonderful area when you are in Yellowstone. The views are breathtaking as a result of not only the depth of the canyon but the kaleidoscopic colours on the canyon faces. Although the falls are a long way from most of the viewpoints, you can sense their power and energy. A great example of the creative power and beauty of nature.

places_url_reviews_title: Beautiful views even when the falls are not gushing with water
places_url_reviews_comment: Had a quick stop here on our drive around the park. Easy to park, not far to walk. There are a few trails as well
Easy to drive and see the sites. Does not take too long and the sites are worth too see. Go see the mud volcano and then stop here on the way back if staying at the Canyon Lodge.

The canyon is not quite the Grand Canyon but it is more accessible and there are good paths that give you a good overview of the canyon including the waterfalls. We went in the late afternoon when the light made the canyon more beautiful.
We visited this area twice while we were in the park. Once on a photo safari and once to take in another opportunity to view this spectacular sight. Truly remarkable!!

This is a top 2-3 of the sites to see in Yellowstone. "Artists point" off the best views and a nearby south rim trail offers a moderate difficulty hike to see some additional amazing views. Uncle toms trail is a tough 329 step hike down to the bottom. It's a pretty strenuous climb but well worth it and there is no reason that you have to go fast so we'd recommend it to anyone without a health reason to not make the climb (my wife and I made the hike with our 1 and 3 yr olds on our backs).

What an incredible display of nature. Yelowstone is just beautiful, it has canyons, geyser's and incredible waterfalls. Definately stop by here to admire the views of the falls, and animals and nature displayed beautifully everywhere, this is a must see.

This was a fabulous hike! We hiked the North and the South Rim and both of the hikes offered stunning views of the Canyon and the Upper and Lower Falls. Neither hike was too difficult. In my opinion, this is the most beautiful hiking area in the park. Take your time and enjoy the view - well worth the effort!!!!

This was our second trip to Yellowstone so we skipped Old Faithful. We came in the north entrance (wonderful stone arch dedicated to Teddy Roosevelt) after staying overnight in Bozeman. BTW, if you are over 65, buy a Senior pass: free admittance to all national parks. You get your $10 back in one visit.
. We wanted to see the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone so we turned east at Mammoth Springs (what wonderful old buildings!). We picked the lower falls - the views are all along the rim. To see the best view of the falls, try the wooden walkway down into the canyon. It is a spectacular canyon! Then we drove over to Norton Basin (stopping for a picnic at the Virginia Cascades - picnic tables at the end of the loop). The Basin has a nice museum and several walks through the geysers. Fascinating!
To leave the park through the east entrance, you drive by the immense Lake Yellowstone. It's a long way to Cody (30 minutes to the East entrance, 50 more to Cody) but the canyon on the way is beautiful.
We came back into the park the next day and left by the south entrance, right into the Tejons NP. Be sure to keep your entry receipt or have that Senior pass ready.
FYI. Gas is available all over the park. Take a picnic so you can skip the Grills and restaurants that are filled by buses. Picnic tables everywhere and in beautiful areas.

places_url_reviews_title: One of our Best National Park tours
places_url_reviews_comment: Our visit was actually 5 years ago, & I hadn't finished it on-line. It was a September visit and we drove a rental care through the Park on the Loop. (Our visit was actually 5 years ago, & I hadn't finished it on-line...) We saw bison, elk and beautiful water throughout the day-trip.
Definitely stop to take in the view and get some pictures. Falls are big and pretty. There was an osprey nest on one side of the falls, atop some rock formations. Make sure you bring your binoculars!
As long as you're not in a rush, the hike is fairly easy. There are many amazing views along all of the different trails at the canyon. Bring water!
Beautiful views, but way too many people. Steep hike back to car. Don't even try to push a stroller.
Loved the waterfalls, and the breath taking views from the different look out points! Stop at a visitors station within Yellowstone and have a ranger give you a detailed map to follow!!
Iconic location. Drop dead gorgeous! ...I don't need a hundred characters to review this. Just read everyone else's reviews. You'll get the picture.

If you're in YNP, be sure to visit this place. It's not Grand Canyon... canyon, but most definitely a nice place to visit here in the YNP. I wish they had trail that lead down to base of the waterfall...
Must stop during a trip to Yellowstone. What a great view. I recommend taking the Uncle Tom's trail down to the bottom to see the lower falls. It's well worth it

If you've been to the Grand Canyon, you won't be disappointed with the views and beauty of the grand canyon of Yellowstone. Take the walk down uncle Tom's trail to see the lower falls. It's a bit of a hike, but definitely worth it.

places_url_reviews_title: Evening Stroll along the South Rim
places_url_reviews_comment: Definitely worth a quick hike and evening stroll after dinner. The waterfall is intense from the ledge right above it. The view back further from Grand View and Lookout seemed the best. Enjoy the wonder.

Located in the center of Yellowstone, the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is, in my opinion, the best attraction in the park. It is a short drive south of the Canyon Village & Visitor Center. We went to both the north and south rims - to get a different view of the canyon and the falls. The "Lookout Point" on the north rim gives you a closer look at the lower fall. The "Artist Point" on the south rim give you a more complete impression of the canyon; it is one of the most popular spots to take pictures. I highly recommend visiting both rims but keep in mind that the north rim road is a one-way road and you will end up going back to the Canyon Village.
You can also take one of the trails to go down to the bottom of the lower fall but there are a lot of stairs to climb; it is not recommended if you don't have much time.

This is an amazing stop in the park, you can drive or hike to the overlooks and see the canyon and beautiful waterfalls. The overlooks have a low boulder wall/barrier that seems a little unsafe if you get too close to the edge. Someone fell to their death just about a week or so before we were there.

places_url_reviews_title: One of the best sight of Yellowstone
places_url_reviews_comment:
This is probably one of the best sites in Yellowstone National Park.
What is upsetting is that you can easily miss this place due to the poor Signage on the park roads, this is about a mile or two south of Canyon and it is on a side Road to the east of the main Road, so people can easily miss the turn that say Artist Point, how silly is that? So we where lucky and we did stop by and the view is just magnificent with the colors of the Canyon and the river under. This was truly breath taking!
If you are at Yellowstone, you must make a stop here. It is so beautiful and there are several hikes around the falls. Parking fills up fast. This is one of the highlights of my visit.
To me is one of the most beautiful views in Yellowstone Park you should go early in the morning since it's less people and you can take really nice pictures

It is a definite must stop at when your in the park. There is a long walk down to the lower falls on a broken trail (has guardrails/hand rails) but worth the trek with picture opportunities & the occasional chipmunk. The trek up is a little more difficult but they have benches at every turn which are a welcome site.

Beautiful scenery, see the upper falls before the lower falls, because the lower falls overlook offers spectacular views in all directions. A lovely part of YNP and definitely worth the drive. Great wildlife viewing along the drive. Look for osprey nests once you arrive.

This is a must visit in Yellowstone NP. The Grand canyon has spectacular rock cliff formations with an amazing powerful waterfall. No matter what side of the canyon you see this place it is amazing with lots of viewing areas which you can walk or drive too. There are limited parking at some viewing areas so patience or walking will be the solution.

Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is definitely worth seeing. The waterfalls are beautiful, and the colors of the canyon are striking. The walk down to the brink of the lower falls is fairly steep and may be a hard climb back up if you are not in good shape. Definitely go to Artist Point.

The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is twenty miles long. The canyon is up to 4,000-feet wide and 1,200-feet deep in places. From several vantage points, you can view Lower Falls plunging steeply into the canyon 308 feet, or the Upper Falls tumbling 109 feet. The various yellow, red, pink, and white mineral stains mark the locations of hot springs and steam vents in the canyon walls. "Most of the yellows in the canyon are the result of iron present in the rock rather than sulfur, as many people think."
We enjoyed the beauty of this easy stop, however, we did not enjoy the large crowds. Many recommend going early if you can but if you are driving the loop and not staying in the park then that is hard. The beauty is worth the hassle of fellow tourists. ;) It was quite an unexpected sight in YNP compared to all the thermal attractions.
This is a site you could sit and look at all day and never get tired of. We went to the upper and lower and still love looking at the canyon the best. A site I will never forget.
Breathtaking....is all I can say ...do not miss. Picturesque..one of my favorite spots. Entire family loved the view. Was able to get some great pictures

I recommend getting there early. We arrived at 8:30 am and the crowds hadn't arrived and we had a pleasant visit. Old faithful erupted on the scheduled time on the info board. While waiting, a volunteer with a radio told us of another guider that was bigger and longer lasting was almost ready so we saw it first then after a short time watched Old faithful.
Don't miss this
Ps we actually got some cell service there

This is the second year in a row we visited Yellowstone and the Canyon area is one of my favorites. We spent about three hours visiting the different points to view the Upper and Lower Falls. We did not take Uncle Tom's Trail, but stopped at the Brink of the Upper and Lower Falls, Artists Point, and a couple more places along the North Rim Drive. The different views of the falls are spectacular. We especially enjoyed Artists Point and the Brink of the Upper Falls....you are standing directly over the falls and the noise of the rushing water is awesome. My husband in unable to walk long distances or inclines and he was able to walk to both brinks as well as Artists Point without any difficulty.

We parked at Wapiti Lake trailhead and walked the trail along the South Rim up to Artist Point and then back down to the Wapiti parking area via Lily Pad Lake and Clear Lake (this takes you through some geyser areas that make you feel like you are on another planet, but also through some beautiful valley/hill views). I was nervous for families with young children that did not seem to understand the perils of falling into the canyon if they did not keep their children close at hand! An absolute must-see area of the park!

This was my favorite part of Yellowstone. It's absolutely stunning. The colors are spectacular. There are numerous lookouts to stop at and take in the views. Most are a short walk. We didn't do any hiking to the lower lookout points since we were with a child and it started raining really heavy.
Gorgeous view of the upper and lower falls. Saw an eagle on the nest on rock formation below the overlook.

The grand canyon of Yellowstone can be viewed from a number of vantage points and it is definitely worth going to them all. It is just as gorgeous as Arizona's, but it a bit more accessible and the colors and calls are completely breathtaking.
The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is beautiful---a must see!!! The upper & lower falls are stunning as well.
Visited the falls with a group of about 30 people including youth and stopped for photos - a very popular spot for photographers and visitors

The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is truly amazing. We had incredible weather last week on our trip which probably made it even more spectacular. We even got to see a rainbow across the falls. You cannot go wrong anywhere in Yellowstone Park as there is so much to see. Enjoy!

Each scenic overlook of the Grand Canyon Loop offers unique vantage points to admire but the second offered an added, unexpected treat...a view of a huge eagle nest (complete with eaglets) atop a towering rock formation within the canyon. The amazing emerald streaked water and majestic wildlife of the Canyon Loop made it a family favorite and a treasured memory of everything that is special about Yellowstone. Make sure you go to upper observation area even though eagle nest is visible from lower area.

This vista was the best sight for us at Yellowstone . We hiked to the lower falls , the path is steep and half way down turns into grated metal steps. There are benches to sit / rest if needed and the steps are wide enough to accommodate foot traffic coming and going in either direction. Once at the bottom there is a nice landing and an awesome view of the lower falls. The upper falls trail is very easy to access and also provides excellent views. A short distance from this access point is a stop called artist point, make sure to see this , all of Yellowstone is breathtaking , it allows you to see the lower falls as it cascades into the steep canyon below . This is a must see.

The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone lives up to its name! The walls are steep, steep. It takes about 350 steps downward on metal steps, and then you have to climb back up. The reward is the beautiful Upper and Lower Falls. This is a must see!!

Absolutely spectacular! The colors, rock formations, waterfalls, displayed beautifully by it's creator, our Heavenly Father over MILLIONS of years. Don't miss this! The National Parks Service has done a fabulous job of creating many vantage points for viewing these wonders!

Even though it was pouring rain when we visited, it is a awesome sight to behold. Magnificent color in the rock that Mother Nature just painted. A beautiful waterfall streaming down, even with thunder and lightning we were able to take great photos. It certainly is a "Grand" Canyon.

places_url_reviews_title: Gorgeous sight, great hiking and views
places_url_reviews_comment: This was another beautiful hidden gem of Yellowstone. We parked and hiked and were able to get beautiful views of the waterfall and canyon.
The Grand Canyon was so high and so wide open that it actually made me apprehensive to go towards the edges. It was a breathtaking view! Definately worth stopping for.
This place was awe inspired, beautiful.....what can I say? There was some hiking to get to some of the views, but well worth it. The falls was superb, really great.
Quite an impressive view. The canyon is just off the loop road which allows pull over parking for the short walk. Like many other sights here are worth seeing.
Elk wandering in the parking lot made this visit even more special. Also saw a bald eagle nest on one of the rock formations.
The waterfalls here are so amazing. I highly recommend going here. It's magnificent and the view and everything is so breathtaking.

We toured here our third day in the park. I guess I enjoy seeing beautiful scenery. The geysers and fumeroles are interesting but I had had enough. When I got here I was absolutely awed. The colors are amazing and beautiful waterfalls. This I would come back for and consider it a must see when in the Park.
Worth the drive. See upper and lower falls. Be careful near edge as a worker in the campground fell to her death last week!

Gorgeous geology showing colors and deep steep areas along with sturdy trees. We stopped every chance we could to get pics. We went earlier in the morning and it wasn't very crowded until we got to Artist's Point. I wish we could have taken Uncle Tom's Trail as I heard it was worth the steep delcine. The waterfalls were flowing strong even in the heat of the end of summer. This is an excellent drive with many oohs and ahhs.

We visited every view point on the south rim, and some of the north rim. Each view was different and completely worth it. We also went in late afternoon to avoid the crowds. But, the place is large and crowds wouldn't interfere with the views. A person can easily walk to all the view points and do a larger hike if they want. This is one of the must see sights in Yellowstone!
This place is amazing! There are different places to see it. Go to Artist's Point for the most scenic view. Here you see the waterfall and the different colors of the canyon.

This is by far one of the highlights of Yellowstone- it's also one of the most picturesque. Depending on where you come in from (either Grand Loop from the south or north, or Norris Canyon Rd. from the west) you will hit either North Rim or South Rim drives first.
The South Rim Drive will take you to Uncle Tom's trail, a short and easily accessible trail that follows along the canyon and to Artist's Point, which is easily one of my favorite sights.
North Rim Drive is a loop from Canyon Village south to Grand Loop Rd near the South Rim Drive and has view access of its own to the brink of both falls and to Inspiration Point (which sadly was closed when we drove through).
Overall it was a great experience (although not very child-friendly) in Yellowstone!
The grand Canyon of Yellowstone has many great views and hikes. Make sure you come here when you visit.

This is one of my favorite spots inside the park. Very beautiful scenery. Sadly, the place was so overwhelmed with tourists, some quite unruly. Really ruined the supposedly calm and peaceful atmosphere. I want to go back again, may be in spring or fall to really appreciate it.
This is an incredible marvel of nature with stunning views offered from many different locations. If you go to Yellowstone you MUST see it.
Amazing natural beauty. We stayed for 4 days and spent half a day in and around the Grand Canyon. A mix of short and easy trails and awesome views make this a totally worthwhile visit.

Plenty of steps if you want to get all the viewpoints of the falls but well worth it. We did the south rim first (by far the best) and later the north (still worth seeing). After the falls, the path travels along the rim of the canyon for some distance and its a lovely and varied hike as the scenery opposite changes constantly.

You're going to want to get up around 5am every day and get out on the road. That early in the day, you'll see mule deer, porcupines, etc. Also, the parking lots will be empty, the construction zones will be down, and the roads will be free of traffic. Additionally, it will be cool. The downside is that the cool air makes the steam more visible, which obstructs the view of the thermal features.
The park has clearly marked trails and a wide variety of land types: volcanic geysers/pools, grasslands, mountains, rivers, canyons, waterfalls etc. I highly recommend Uncle Tom's hike.

My husband and our two teenage children really enjoyed seeing this. I was surprised to see such a great waterfall in Yellowstone. The canyon is long, but a bend in it limits views to only part of it at a time. The cliffs and waterfall are spectacular to see.
This was a favorite stopping point as we did a 3 day tour of Yellowstone. We were there toward the evening hours and loved how the sun lit up the formations. Make sure to make this stop.

What an incredible display of nature. Beautiful waterfall surrounded by a bright yellow canyon. Visions of the Grand Canyon in a compacted view. Like most everything in Yellowstone, this is a must see.

After studying Alfred Bierstadt in Art History, I found it hard to believe that Artist Point would be anything like his painting. What with all the park visitors crowding around, plus global warming and pine beetle damage, I figured the view couldn't be as beautiful and the trees would be gone. I am not pessimistic; I just assumed he made it more vibrant than it was in reality.
Wow, was I wrong, and so happy to be wrong! This place is as lovely to see as any place I have been. The water is like green glass, the canyon walls are subtle pastels, the trees are deep green, and all I have is this camera. Sigh...next time I'm bringing my paintbox.

The Grand Canyon at Yellowstone is fantastic. It's not like the North and South Rims of the Canyon but a masterpiece you can only see in Yellowstone. The mountains and waterfalls are simply beautiful and something you should not miss while your in the park. This is definitely one of the top 10 things to see in the park

Land, Waterfall and Bright Blue Sky with an wide expense of lush green land and mountains all juxtapositioning was effect.
While we were there, a rainbow showed itself across the falls. A place not to be missed if you are in the area.

We made a day hike along the South Rim. Although the parking lot at the upper falls was full, the trail and viewing areas did not seem full. Great views all along the south rim trail. The hike was relatively easy, except for the spur with the long staircase. The north rim parking areas and viewing areas looked over full, so we did not go there.
The waterfalls and scenery here are magnificent. In summer, be prepared to find parking scarce and people everywhere.

We've visited the Grand Canyon in Arizona several times and this sighting of Yellowstone's Grand Canyon was equally awe inspiring. The rushing waters from the water falls was a wonderful symphony highlighted by solo bird arias singing the beauty of nature. One additional surprise, a majestic bull elk was ruling his domain from a nearby copse of trees. Then there was the bonus of a bull bison easing along the roadway as we returned to our room at the Best Western Weston Inn.

places_url_reviews_title: Most Spectacular View in the Park(Well at least one of the best)
places_url_reviews_comment: Words can't describe how beautiful the falls are. Go to both the North and South sides of the falls. It is worth it.

Stop and park along the road, traffic will be crazy. Be ready to hike a little way but so worth it at the end! Breathtaking!! And amazing. Words can not describe the beauty you will see. Doesn't even look real!
Came here 36 years ago, still amazing sight despite crowds in August, we came June last time, hardly anybody here then. It is like a mini "Grand Canyon".

places_url_reviews_title: Hike - don't drive everywhere you can!
places_url_reviews_comment: Unbelievable scenic beauty and best seen by walking to every overlook and every trail! Truly one of the most beautiful areas in the park!!
This can be viewed many different ways and it is magical. I suggest doing all the hikes you can but there are pull offs if you want the easy way. Hit the park early to avoid crowds.

places_url_reviews_title: Yellowstone Park is one of the best parks in the U.S.A. It's a must see.
places_url_reviews_comment: Yellowstone Park is a must see and one of the best parks in the U.S. A. The beautiful mountain and lake scenery is intermixed with geysers and mud pots. You have to do some driving to see the different sights and the park is really busy in the summer, but it is well worth it.
